review: Love this beautiful outdoor mall and love this restaurant to boot. Ordered a small salad loaf and split margarita pizza. I had to ask for extra dressing as the salad was pretty dry. You can't please everyone in this department so no stars taken off for this.  Our waitress was polite and efficient. Margareta pizza was delicious however there were dry spots missing cheese. Not enough cheese. A pizza restaurant that lacks cheese on it's pizza. Step it up folks.

CPK is one of my favorite restaurants (after Cheesecake Factory). The pizza is great, but my favorite dishes are their salads. The Thai Crunch Salad includes edamame, peanuts, rice sticks, wonton strips, and a terrific peanut dressing. By ordering the dinner portion and only eating half, I can take home the remainder with extra dressing. When added to lettuce, my leftovers can make 2-3 more meals. They serve bread and olive oil automatically at each table. The bread is made fresh and very tasty (as is the olive oil). Employees at this and other CPKs have always been very professional in their service to customers. When traveling, CPK is a great place to pick up a to-go order to eat back in your hotel room. Call ahead and you'll be out the door in no time at all.

Love coming her for lunch. I always sit at the bar for quick service. D is usually the guy that helps my boyfriend and I, and my oh my. He is the best! He has a charismatic attitude and shows that he loves his job. He remembers our name and is super accommodating.  I love the lunch special with soup and pizza. I usually eat the veggie pizza and potato soup or something ha. I also order a Blueberry Ginger Smash. It's delicious. Sweet. Tangy and just the right amount of alcohol.

This location in Town Square is my favorite location bu when we ate here last Sunday, the service lacked. The gentleman who was our host was not the sharpest or the most attentive. We actually had to get from our seats to go to him to ask for items that we needed. He hardly checked up in us and when when our drinks were low, we had to wait a while before he hot to toping off our drinks.  The food was delicious as always. We ordered the Thai Crunch Salad and a small cheese and pepperoni pizza.  I will not rule out not coming back to this place but I will not be in a hurry to go back.

CPK! The amazing pizza HEAVEN!  From the classic BBQ chicken pizza, Club pizza, California Veggie Pizza on Wheat crust, Waldorf Chicken and Chinese Chicken Salad, Avocado Egg Rolls, Mediterranean Veggie Roll, Chicken Tequila,  Chicken Piccata with non angel hair pasta for more saucy noodles, Roasted Veggie Salad to mojitos are all amazing and couldn't go wrong! I've been to multiple locations, but Town Square had a renovation and is beautiful more than ever! Great place to go with family, friends and events.

Its been a long time since ive been to CPK. This most recent time, we had decided to come to CPK for dinner for something small, prior to an event nearby. We had arrived around 630-645ish and were seated within 5 minutes. We had opt'ed to sit outside because the weather had been amazing these past few days. One side to outdoor seating was already full. The other side had two 2-person tables left.  Our waiter had came fairly soon after we had been seated and got our drink orders placed. We had both opted for a "uniquely non-alcoholic" drink Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler which consisted of fresh strawberries hand-shaken w/ Fresca and Monin South Seas, featuring natural flavors of mango, guava, and ginger.  Not too sweet. Quite refreshing. Nice to enjoy on a nice day out :) We both had enjoyed our drinks. I ate her strawberries too. There was a slice of lime in the drink too ! No i didnt eat that Lol  --------------------------- Along with our drink orders, we had ordered some food as well. Not too much, but enough to hold us until the event which had desserts and champagne provided.. XD  Before our food came out, we were served with some fresh warm bread with a small bowl of olive oil and herb. The bread was super tasty and fresh. Nice crispy crust and soft inside. The olive oil and herb tasted really nice as well !  Spinach Artichoke Dip served hot with housemade blue & white corn tortilla chips Surprisingly for an appetizer, its quite the large portion of dip. Their housemade chips were thin and crispy. The dip isnt too overpowering/strong but creamy and delicious. Yummy !  Carne Asada Pizza w/ tender marinated steak, fire-roasted poblanos, cilantro pesto, yellow onions, mozzarella, monterey jack cheese and fresh cilantro served with housemade salsa verde This was like... a taco as a pizza. "New item" on the menu. Lol the steak was indeed tender, topped with the side of housemade salsa verde really made this like a taco. Very tasty. Fairly decent to try ! Ingredients melded pretty nice and worked well together.  Even with this amount of food, we still had 2 slices of pizza leftover, which i had taken home to eat as a snack later that night HAHA !  ------------------------ Overall, great experience. Was nice to enjoy the nice outdoor weather while its lasts cuz everyone knows vegas weather is bipolar. Also nice to have a nice partner to enjoy it with hehe
Excellent service food was great !!! California club pizza is amazing, Sicilian pizza great as well, avocado egg rolls . Overall just amazing
This has been my 2nd or 3rd time here.  Service, atmosphere, and food were all very good.

Met up with the wife today for lunch at California Pizza Kitchen. We ordered waters and were delivered some warm fresh bread with oil and herbs. I added some balsamic vinegar to make it just right.  This location was recently remodeled and has a new fresh look inside. The staff was very warm and welcoming and even brought us out a Bianco Flatbread for coming in today. This included whipped truffle cream, gorgonzola, mozzarella cheeses and fresh sage. Very nice of them. For the meal we decided on splitting a full size Thai Crunch, we could have had a half size but now I have some leftovers for dinner. The salad was delicious and comes with crisp veggies and fresh cilantro, chicken and peanuts, wontons and rice sticks, then it's tossed in a Thai peanut dressing. We also added fresh avocado to the salad ($3 up charge).  The avo complemented the salad and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal. Thank you CPK  for a great lunch.

Somehow I just dined at CPK (as people tell me it's called) for the first time. This location is conveniently located smack in the middle of Town Square near Whole Foods and The Container Store. We arrived just before noon and waited a few minutes to be seated. The restaurant was nearly full for lunch on a weekday. Once seated our waitress came over soon after to take our drink orders and then our food orders when we were ready. She didn't waste time getting orders in, but didn't rush us to order either. The menu has a nice variety of options and they definitely offer more than just pizza. The lunch combination option had quite a few items to choose from and was reasonably priced. It includes pizza, sandwiches, soups, and salads. There were fun drink options like non-alcoholic refreshers and teas too. Calorie counts are listed next to each item which made it easy to make a smarter choice. I went with the combination of Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza and a Caesar Salad. The salad was tasty and I liked the garlic croutons. The pizza was a nice size. I liked the overall flavor and the crust on the pizza. We had to pass on dessert since we were on a lunch break, but they had some good looking options that I'd love to try next time.

We've been here a few times now this year.  Servers are whatever.  Not really there went you need them.  No bread or refills.  Doesn't even come by to check on the table.  It does get busy during lunchtime and dinnertime.  Just happy the food quality is the same every time.  The wait isn't longer than 10 minutes.  We did come on Valentine's Day, good thing I made a reservation.  We only have to wait about 10-15 minutes.  Otherwise I heard the wait time was an hr and 45 minutes.  Yuck!  I always order the California Club Pizza.  Husband tries different things.  The recent one was the Shrimp Scampi Pizza, sooo good!  A little spicy if you're not into that, you can ask them to make it less or without.

I recently visited this CPK location on a Saturday night. We got there around 5pm with a party of 4 plus a high chair. We were told that the wait would be about 15 mins.  When about 15 minutes passed we were called. The Host tried to seat us at a table meant for 4. As we realized that it would be pretty tight, I noticed a number of tables which were empty. It amounted to a whole section which was closed as they ran a wait list. We asked for another table with more room and we were directed to wait again.  When we got our new table about 10 minutes after that we noticed that the section was still closed.  For an appetizer we ordered the white corn guacamole and chips. For dinner, we ordered the California Veggie Pizza and a Roasted Veggie Salad.  The guacamole came out right away. The portion was rather small and in my opinion lacked flavor. We added salt to it.  Dinner took a while to come out, in my opinion, longer than it should have. When it did we again found that the California Veggie Pizza lacked flavor and needed salt. I will say that the Roasted Veggie Salad was good.  With so many other restaurants in Town Square to chose from, CPK needs to step up their game.

First time coming to this location because I usually go to the one in Glendale, CA. The location is big, nice, and in a good location too.  Got half bbq chicken/pepperoni pizza and some spaghetti. That's what we usually always get, and I'm glad that it was still as yummy as the other location I go to.  Also got a red berry sangria with was good but had too much ice and tasted more like a juice more than anything.  Bathroom are also clean!  Can't wait to come back.

I came out here to meet a friend. It was my first time at this location, and I must say I was blown away with the service. The server brought us some free cheesy flatbread with sage, she said it was for first time customers. Free food is always a nice surprise!  The service was pretty quick, too. The server was on top of her game. She came by often to check in on us and give us refills. I ordered the pepperoni pizza. It might be boring but it was tasty. For dessert, the salted caramel pudding is AMAZING. I highly recommend it.

Came here on a Tuesday night around 7/8. There were a couple of parties ahead of us. It was a 10-15 minute wait. I was honestly surprised that there was even a wait since it was a weekday.  Anyway, we were seated at a table that I felt like was way too big for 3 people. Lol there are plenty of good choices on the menu! I was stuck because I really wanted to order something fatty... but I knew I couldn't *insert crying emoji*. I settled for the chicken & veggies - sorry, I don't remember the exact name of the dish. My bf ordered the same thing & my friend had the pasta. We were given bread before our food came; it was hot & delicious! I like that they put herbs and I think chili flakes in the oil. The food came out maybe 15-20 mins later. The chicken & veggies were sooooo good. I was honestly surprised because I thought it would be bland. The portion was pretty big so I took half for my lunch the next day!  The service was okay, no complaints. She always made sure that our waters were filled but didn't really talk or ask questions much. Will definitely come back!

California Pizza Kitchen has always felt overrated to me but then again I guess it's because I don't like eating at places that don't keep it real about the ingredients that they use. That's a different review though let me give some credit where it is due! Specifically for this visit to the Town Square location my co worker invited me to a nice business lunch. We arrived and of course the place was packed because hello it's lunch time duh!  Talked to the hostess about the wait and was quayside maybe 15 minutes. 20 minutes later we were finally seated and I can't be made because hey it was only 5 minutes of a difference! I was looking for something light and not really in the mood for pizza but seriously who declines a free lunch? Not me!  Ahh but if course they have an extensive menu with alternate options so why not be open to a spinach And quinoa said with a nice piece of Salmon on top! Sounds good to me! I washed it down with one of the new refreshing cucumber mint drinks! Super yummy and out server made it an effort to not let my glass stay empty that was the best part! The full portion salad is huge and I really should've down the lunch size but whatever it was so worth it! The service here was amazing so I really have to come back again this time not for business so I can have a great cocktail! Great job CPK!

Can't really give a fair review about the food cause we never got that far.  Checked with the hostess about a booth for two and was told a small wait please have a seat. After sitting down in the waiting area two separate couples also checked in after us.  Well one couple, who came in after us, was escorted to a booth. I thought perhaps they called in for reservations and no big deal. Then after an additional longer wait the second couple was escorted to a booth. I couldn't believe it so I went up to the hostess and asked what was going on?  She could only say she was sorry and it would be just a few minutes longer as they cleaned a booth.  I advised that I would like to speak with the manager after we get seated. The two of us was seated in a booth big enough to sit eight.  Unreal!  When the manager arrived I explained what occurred, and she was apologetic. I pointed out that families were waiting in the sitting area and we could not take this large booth while they waited as it wasn't right. I explained that we would just leave so she offered a rain check.  We refused the rain check and departed.  I can only say hospitality starts at the front door, and should extend throughout the establishment, but we didn't really feel it inside, and we do have choices where we wish to spend our money.  California Kitchen was one of our first choices but won't be a choice in the future.

CPK is amazing! Hubby and I came here for dinner on our date nite/xmas shopping & they didn't fail!  Avocado Roll & Dumplings are a MUST!! And dinner entree was even better. Butter Cake for dessert topped off the nite! Will def b back  Thanks CPK!!

Pros: The food is very delicious. My wife and I tried "dynamite shrimp" and "BBQ chicken pizza". Both were great especially the shrimp which was served with a sweet and yummy sauce. nice place next to the casino and all craziness.  Cons: The waiting time was relatively long. The food price is expensive; 7" pizza starts from ~$20 and starter from ~$12.

This cpk is way better then the ones in in orange county California. Oh my my my the Jamaican jerk chicken. Pizza is delicious something i never experienced in my life. Great service. Also.  Will be coming back

My husband and I decided to have lunch here while at Town Square.  The waitress was friendly and informative.  We told her we had never been to a California Pizza Kitchen and asked a few questions.  A few minutes later the manager came to our table with completely cheesy flatbread as a "Welcome to our establishment we are happy to chose to come join us today."  It was really good.  My husband and I shared Chicken Piccatta and it was delicious.   The service, food and size of the portions  was great.  We will be going back in the future.

I got the artichoke and spinach pizza and it was super delicious. Jasmine was the best server. She was very attentive and was right there when we needed or brought us drinks before we even had to ask. She made our night.

Today our server Angie, was soooo great!! She definitely treated us like we were in a 5 star establishment. My kids were taken care of fully satisfied at the end of the meal.  Angie told us we were her first ever table serving, as she normally works the to-go counter! She totally rocked it! I had the Mac n cheese bites and they keep getting smaller each visit. Also enjoyed my pesto multi grain penne with chicken! The sun dried tomatoes are what MAKES this dish.  The salted caramel pudding is a definite each visit as well. That or the butter cake. Make sure you indulge in your dessert or walk next door to Godiva for some delicious chocolate ice cream!  I can't wait to be back. That pesto carne asada pizza was a weird experience but I'm totally getting it again.
I always always order the Tri Colore pizza. They took it off the menu but they will still make it. Tossed salad on a pizza. Ohh so yummy

Please do not waste your money here..the food quality & customer service is unacceptable & definitely not worth the time! It took about 10 minutes before someone brought us a menu or even a water. I left here with a burnt BBQ California chicken pizza & no efforts in fixing the issue. We will never come back!!
The BBQ chicken salad was great, Andrew enjoyed the oriental salad . The prices have gone up , they are no longer in the $$ bracket they are more in the $$$ group now

WOW, this was by far the BEST experience we have ever had at a CPK.  We usually have fairly good experiences at CPKs. The food is always good, the service is decent, we never really have too much to complain about but my gosh, this location really knows what they're doing.  As soon as we walked in, Jesse politely greeted us & thanked us for coming in to dine with them. I literally felt like I just showed up to his house for dinner, he was so nice. Turns out, he was the GM so that explained his great service. He probably services as an elite example for his staff. We were asked our seating preference and we chose a booth in the bar area.  Our server DeMond really made our experience even better. He was personable and prompt. When we ordered, we went with his suggestion. The Pesto Cream Penne Pasta had great flavor and it was a generous portion of food. We also ordered the California Club pizza & a Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler. The California Club was a unique take on pizza. It came with Arugula tossed salad & fresh avocados on top. My fiancé literally joked, "did you order a salad??". While the presentation was intimidating, the blend of ingredients was genius. We enjoyed everything but what made our experience exemplary was the service we received tonight.  Definitely recommend!

Visited California Pizza Kitchen for the first time since I've lived in Vegas. I Loved going here with my daughter, family, and friends when I lived on the East Coast. I took a friend, he really enjoyed his  being that he's Vegan. It's kinda hard to find good places that are good to eat and the ambiance is inviting. This was his first time ever eating here, and he to really enjoyed himself. Nicole our server was very pleasant and vibrant. Our hostess was also very hospitable. The General Manager, was very attentive to everyone's satisfaction of everything. When the couple came in with a Golden Retriever that's when things started looking like the stars were gonna change to a lower amount. But I know it was absolutely too cold for the dog to be left in the car. They could've also ordered or been recommended to order Take Out. It's a different time and a lot of people really don't respect how other's would see that a animal in a restaurant not being a service animal sitting on the booth seats would be kinda unsanitary and unorthodox. Overall I Love pets, and there human as well in my eyes. I'll definitely go here again.  Thanks again Nicole for your great service.

Stopped in for lunch with my daughter! Was semi busy but told there was a 15 minute was time, so we opted to sit at the pizza counter ! The service at the pizza counter was not the best, I had two different servers asking me questions and checking on me but I never really knew who my server was... Whenever I asked for something, bread, balsamic, ranch, it always took a while for them to return with it. The food was DELICIOUS. I had the bbq pizza with a cease salad lunch special and my daughter had the macaroni and cheese which was SO good. Will definitely be returning , but I recommend avoiding the pizza counter at all costs to get better service

Is it just me or this place is a little too dark? I get the whole "intimate setting" thing but I couldn't help but think about it being too dark in there. Maybe I'm going crazy!   We were seated immediately, drinks came right away, the server took our orders as soon as we were ready, food came 10-15 mins later.  Many food selections, but I chose the basic Fettuccini Alfredo. Pasta was good, sauce was creamy. My friend ordered a chicken dish with mixed veggies. Though I didn't get to try it, their expressions seemed like they weren't disappointed.  I remember coming here every time I was at TS back when I was in HS. I felt like they had better selections then compared to now.

They have some amazing pizza here. They also have pasta, salads, and a variety of other things if you're craving anything else. It's a bit pricey. Their drinks are really strong and aren't pricey. I paid about 8 dollars for a margarita.

This place is just too good. Everything from the food to the service. I can't get enough of this place. The service here is always really good. Very attentive and on point. The variety and quality of the food is what I love here.  We ordered: Thai Chicken Salad - Bomb Waldorf Chicken Salad - Awesome! Spicy chicken Moroccan salad - Really good  Customized flatbread with Goat Cheese, pear, candied walnuts - Awesome  BBQ Chicken Pizza with pineapple (thin crust) - The best Spinach and Artichoke with Chicken - Good, but too rich Mushroom truffle pizza - Ok Tostada Pizza - it's ok Pear & Goat cheese pizza - ok I love the pizza's, big salads, and drinks here. They do so many different styles of dishes so well, I wish they had even more to choose from on their menu.
The food is good, service is usually pretty fast, the drinks are a little pricey, $5 for a bud light and $10 for a Moscow Muel.

I took my kids for Fathers Day lunch at this location. The 4 years old baby had a kids cheese and tomato pizza ,my teenager daughter had some chicken with pasta and I had a salad with extra chicken breast . The kids have shared bites from each other's plates.  8-10 hours after the lunch both of kids can't stop throwing up. As a dad I can't express how I feel about this. From my intentions to provide them a nice lunch with their dad we end up into 24hours of pain and suffering for them. It's sad and sickening that this concept still stays in bussines.  Shame on you California Pizza Kitchen,I really hope you will close doors soon.

I believe his name is Dino... he was beyond amazing! He suggested a mushroom pasta dish that was perfect because I couldn't decide between what I usually get and the pasta. I had a bad experience at a different CPK location, but Dino made up for it without even knowing it. Great service! I hope his management knows how great he is!

Came here for lunch with my friend and her daughter. It was pretty busy so there was a little wait. The inside is nice and decorative. It was cozy. We got sat down and we ordered our lunch I believe Juan was our server. We asked for ice water with lemon and he didn't bring it until we had to ask for it the second time. My friend ordered her pizza without red onions and he forgot to note that down because her pizza came out with red onions. I also ordered the Mediterranean salad with my meal but somehow it was Caesar so he had to switch it out. I also found a small piece of hair in my salad and took it out but I didn't complain about it. The pizzas we all ordered was really good. The appetizers plate that are set at each table before you sat down, one of them was dirty so we didn't use any of the plates that was already there. Our server probably only checked on us once throughout our whole meal. I would definitely recommend they work on better customer service. I gave this place 2 stars for lack of service we got but the food was delicious as it should be. I would like to give this location another try but I like the California pizza on the strip better.

We picked up take-out from here and I ordered the spaghetti bolognese. When my husband brought it home I was disappointed to see that although the noodle portion was generous there was little to no "bolognese sauce" on top. What constituted as their sauce was tidbits of chopped tomato, bits of minced beef and a sprinkle of parsley. Definitely worth the price and it bared no resemblance  to the picture on the website. Very disappointing.

Jamie, the manager, was amazing.  We accidentally placed a pick up at the wrong location. She handles everything for us and helped me with everything. Considering that it was our fault for placing a pick up at the wrong location, they took care of everything. Awesome customer service !

I have been a CPK fan for years!! Today's lunch came short of all my expectations. I could complain about everything that was wrong about my lunch, but I'd rather just talk about the worst part of my lunch. Whatever I ate made me so nauseous and sick to my stomach. If throwing up weren't so painful I would force it out of me.

I've been to this location twice now and the first time I was unimpressed by the service. I wanted a sample of their new sangrias because they looked delicious (but i'm super picky) and was told that its made to order which is new to me because I know that they always premake batches of it early in the day or whenever they run out. Anyway, during the first visit, our server didn't check back with us after we received our food, nor did he offer any water refills.  However, I came back today because it was a birthday celebration. Service tonight was great! Our server was attentive and waters were refilled without us asking. Food is amazing as always.  3/5  wild mushroom strozzapreti- I wasn't a huge fan of the pasta, it was on the harder side so if I were to order this dish again, I would probably sub penne or fusilli for it. I don't believe there was a sauce to it... maybe just olive oil or something but I did enjoy the variety of mushrooms (not that I could tell the different mushrooms apart). My friend said the dish was kind of on the bitter side, but I only had two bites and couldn't really tell nor mind it.  4/5 Kung pao spaghetti with chicken-  despite all the dried red chili peppers, its not spicy! Spaghetti noodles were cooked perfectly, however it was on the salty side and lacked some peanuts. I gave two of my gfs a bite and they loved it.  5/5 Bbq chicken salad with avocado- I've tried lazy dog's, BJs and a few other restaurants' bbq chopped salad and they don't seem to compare to CPK's. The full sized salad made for a good appetizer for the table (party of 6)  before our entrees came out. I was glad that it wasn't drenched in dressing unlike previous visits.  While I didn't try the halibut, two of my gfs ordered it and said it was kind of dry. They did enjoy the farro and said that the halibut was a nice size.

I think the last time I went to a California Pizza Kitchen was at least 4 years ago in Michigan! Surprisingly I haven't gone to the one in Town Square, however, that changed today. One of my girlfriends wanted to catch up with a light lunch and recommended we go here. We shared the Tortilla Spring Rolls as an app - you can choose from 3 different kinds and we got the Mediterranean Veggie and the Thai Chicken (Baja Chicken is the third choice). Three small portions of each came out with a marinara sauce for the veggie and a sweet peanut sauce for the thai spring rolls. They were both pretty tasty and a great way to start our lunch.  I wanted a salad and went with the half portion of the Waldorf Chicken Salad and my friend got the half portion of the Moroccan Chicken Salad. The half portions are humongous and look like a full portion to me. Perfect size for lunch. My salad was incredibly delicious! Mixed greens with grapes, green apples, celery, chicken, candied walnuts, crumbled Gorgonzola, pre-tossed in a light vinaigrette. I wouldn't recommend getting this salad if you don't like Gorgonzola because as you know, it has a strong distinct taste and can be overpowering in any dish. I didn't mind at all because I LOVE cheese and Gorgonzola.  Katie was our server and she was fantastic! Very friendly and checked up on us quite often to make sure we were enjoying everything and to refill our drinks. I'm very satisfied with my lunch today and would gladly go back! Highly recommend California Pizza Kitchen if you're in Town Square and craving a fresh salad. I'll have to try their pizza next time.
Always a good meal.  Service was excellent.  Wait, even on Valentine's Day, was non existent. We were seated right away. And it was busy.  Two thumbs up!

So I just left CPK about 10 minutes ago and couldn't wait to write this review. I've been to this location as well as others and have never received the terrible service I received today. We waiting for 15 minutes for a table...not a problem! It was myself and my 4 kids on a lunch date. Once we got seated, rosabel took our drink order. It was 15 minutes before we got our drinks. When she brought our drinks, she took our food order. By now it was 1245pm.  We then waited another 20 minutes before Angie came and asked if we were ok and brought us bread. She said she understands how it can be with 4 kids so here's some bread to pass the time. First off, it's part of the service.  That was also the first time anyone came to check on our table since they took our order. We then waited for another 30 minutes before Angie came back and apologized for the wait and said she would have her manager come by to see what they could do for us since we waited for over an hour by this point. Shortly after her apology, the food came. We ate and at that point finally got our first refill on our drinks. Once we finished, Angie came back to see if we needed boxes and to bring the check.  The manager never came by like Angie said and the total bill for such service was over $50. Angie said she would be back to collect payment. We waiting another 10 minutes and finally I had my daughter walk it to her. Rosabel then brought it back and we walked out of the restaurant 2 hours after walking in. Definitely not the best experience and very reluctant to go back.

After some exhaustive shopping, Mom, sister and I decided CPK sounded good and with the weather in Vegas being so fabulous (it's that 2 week window between being hot as an over and cold as a freezer), we decided we'd dine al fresco.  We were immediately seated and our wonderful server (who's name I regrettably didn't get) immediately took our drink and dinner order.  We started with a large Caesar salad to share and it was, well...ok. It wasn't like the CPK Caesar I remember. It just seemed lacking-the dressing was almost non-existent on parts of it. The croutons and Parmesan cheese were, however, delicious. On to the star of the show...the pizza. My mom and I ordered the roasted garlic chicken pizza. Onions, garlic, chicken, cheese...need I say more? I'm quite certain that our breath was kickin' afterward but it was worth it. So good. So, so, so good! My sister ordered the club pizza and she liked it but it wasn't that great as a leftover-mainly due to the avocados on it.  The service was top notch, the pizza was on point and all in all, you just can't go wrong with CPK!

I haven't written a Yelp review before, but unfortunately, my last two visits to this CPK have been so bad that I felt the need to post this review. The first time we went (1/21/17), we had an okay experience. The food was good overall, though there were a few things that were off: the bread was stale, our food came with toppings we specifically requested removed, and the raspberry iced tea was mostly too-sweet raspberry flavoring with a pinch of tea. The service was also a bit slow, but we enjoyed our time there. So, using a gift card I had been given, I tipped just under 10% -- leaving the balance exactly $11. Today (4/2/17) we went again, and it was a great expereience. The food, drinks and service were fantastic, and we were very happy during our time there. The problem came when we went to pay the bill. I still had my original receipt from my old gift card, which showed it should have had $11 left. However, when we went to pay, it the balance was only $8. I was shocked, and then, disturbed to realize that the server from our first experience--who turned out to be our same server today, Chad--had clearly tipped himself an extra $3 when he ran our card back in January. I didn't want to cause a scene and call him out--we had a fine time there today, after all--but that kind of behavior is inexcuseable. Since our server took the liberty of tipping himself extra last time, we left without leaving a tip. We love CPK-- but hate that our date was turned sour by staff's shady behavior. Safe to say, we sadly won't be returning to this location again.

I was extremely disappointed and shocked today by California pizza kitchen, I've eaten here many times and have never had an issue but today the waiter asked us three times what our order was before finally having it come out after an hour of waiting. The worst part wasn't even that wait, while eating my salad, I found a cockroach in the plate!!! The assistant manager told me that it was unfortunate but a reality for places using "fresh" produce. I felt that it was highly unprofessional that he would suggest that, or suggest that we order anything off the menu, as the last thing I'd want to eat is anything from that kitchen. I asked for corporates number multiple times and he just kept restating that he'd give us his business card and we could contact him if we needed anything. (We never got the number for corporate.) In the end we left with two gift cards for 15$ that will basically get you 1 pepperoni pizza. Nice to know that my business and health is worth $15. I will never return to this CPK again. 0/10, DONT RECOMMEND AT ALL.

Its a chain, so food is consistent. Service was great....but the food is just ok for me. I usually avoid CPK, but went here for a birthday, and had fun. This time the food was good, our waiter was super nice and we had a great time. Because of this I gave this CPK a higher rating then normal.
After trick or treating thru town square we decided to stop in. Dinner was great, service was on point and our server found us a $10 off coupon, score ! Thanks CPK for great service.

I know this is a common restaurant to go to around the US and I've been to a handful. Something about this particular location just seemed "meh"? Not a lot of flavor in their dishes and their service was slow. I'll try a different location instead of this one.
Having a great time ...food as usual ,  fabulous. Mannison took great care of us.  Nice guy !!

I don't come here often, but when I do it's always because I'm craving Thai crunch salad.  Ordered: 1 (half) Thai Crunch Salad, 1 fettuccine penne pasta (with shrimp) -- MORE than enough for two to share.  We were too full to even order any dessert, but we recommend the BUTTER CAKE any day.  Only reason I give a 4 star today is because during my visit today, the I ordered the Thai crunch without chicken, and the plate came back with chicken. I appreciate the manager taking his time to apologize to us, but that doesn't do anything about the additional wait time we had to endure.  ...but I'll still be back! :)

I've been here a few times before,I use to love this place!my recent visit not so much!the bread they offered was hard as a rock! The server take too long to bring our drinks and he not so friendly seems like another day in a job for him,dissatisfied

Stopped in for dinner with the fam. We were seated directly in front of the door initially as I was distracted by "checking in", however when I noticed I asked to be moved catercorner to another both.  The greeter had no issue moving us and our server swapped stations to stay with us (A for effort).  Our server was patient while we decided and offered suggestions.  I took her advise and tried the Roasted Veggie Salad which I found that I actually like artichokes - who knew!  My youngest ordered the Garlic Fettuccine w/ Shrimp, but returned it after trying to give it life (flavor) by adding more cheese.  The manager came over to coax her into trying another dish, but it was too late.  The rest of us enjoyed our choices; The Works Pizza and a Waldorf Salad both yummy!  Great go-to for my fam when we hit Town Square!!

Love this place always have. They service here every time have been super nice. Even got the recipe for our favorite Sangria. Came to pick up some food for dinner and visitors and curb side was kind of perfect even though it is in a busy shopping park.  Food is always great our favorite the Tequila Chicken Alfredo and the Jamaican Jerk pizza yummmmmmm!  Get your own though unless you aren't that hungry.

Had dinner last night with a friend and was a little disappointed.  Ordered Bianco flatbread that was very dry to my taste. And a quinoa and arugula salad that had more baby spinach than arugula.  The salad was good and fresh thanks to the cheese and dried tomatoes it was made with.  The staff is great, good service. The manager, very friendly, came several times to our table and our waiter was very nice too.  I'll go back even though I expect better quality of food....

Came here starving while shopping. Our waiter was Rich he was very upbeat and had a good energy about him. I gave this place a 5 just for the prompt and exceptional service. Food is good pretty standard for CPK.
Not bad.  Had linguini Which was kinda dry but not bad tasting.  Good service but a bit pricey.  20.00 for plate of pasta without meat. Open and noises atmosphere.  Basically, fast food.

Our server JT was fabulous!  A wonderful Italian man who was so nice and friendly! We celebrated Mother's Day here with the family...we enjoyed ourselves!  We had pizza, a ribeye steak, pasta, and fish tacos...all very good!!!

Went here for my Mom's birthday dinner, my mom and dad loved the crispy Mac and cheese and their pizza. (mushroom pizza) My BF liked his garlic chicken Pizza, I apparently was the only one who picked the bad pizza. The five cheese and tomato one was literary cheese on bread with tomatoes on it, I guess I figured there would be marinara sauce, I asked for some on the side and it was fine.  I'll come back for the other pizzas my advice would be don't waste your money on the five cheese "pizza." We had Tyler as our server and he was really nice, engaged in conversation with us and even gave my mom a birthday sundae for free. He's a keeper, I would definitely come back just because of his amazing service.

Jasmyn is an angel. I came here for my birthday with my girlfriends and the food was good but the service was better. (The food was definitely 100% amazing). Jasmyn had so much knowledge about the menu and I loved it! I couldn't decide what to order and she helped me out. She's also the sweetest girl ever. She was SO fun. What topped it off for me is she chose my "birthday desert" based off of getting to know my likes ordering. She brought out this delicious butter cake with ice cream and it was to die for. She made me feel special, on my special day. I will definitely be coming back and will 100% hope I get her section again.

This is probably one of my family's usual places where we go to dinner. Our waiters always are on top of their game. But tonight 10/10/17 our waiter was James we were there probably a good hour and a half and we only saw him when we ordered, got our food, one refill and to check out. I guess we were the last table of his for the night, but we had to wait and wait for him to come out from the back to even get his attention. He gave off the vibe that he didn't want to be there and he was in a hurry because he wouldn't even let us answer his questions, he would just answer for us. (He asked if we wanted boxes and before we could answer he just said okay three boxes it is and walked off before we even asked the questions we needed to ask or even order out desert) We just didn't even bother with the second dessert we just decided to leave. It was so bad that I contemplated even talking to the manager because when we were leaving we payed and he came back right away to ask where his tip was. Honestly I cannot fathom how terrible tonight was. But to our past waiters/waitresses thank you for your hospitality. We did not leave a tip but I am not sorry for not leaving the waiter a tip but I am sorry for the buss boy who won't be getting his portion. We were going to give it directly to him but did not see him as we were leaving.

I finally came to eat here! I've heard of this place for so long but never really made time to Check it out. My girlfriend and I  Came in and noticed it was very busy, we waited 15 min ( reasonable) We were served by Antonio, who was also serving the bar... ( wow)  at first I thought I was going to have a horrible first time experience, but No, Antonio let me know he was a little busy but will be checking on us, I asked him for some recommendations and he actually took the time to tell me all the popular menu choices. Definitely really good pasta and pizza! We will be definitely be coming back for the food and Antonio! Thanks for the awesome one on one service!

Yum yum yum! Solid four stars. Wide selection. Really friendly staff. Good beer selection and lots of cool cocktails. Love the location, atmosphere, and noise level. We will be back! Sign up for the rewards program for the free small plate!

Brought my mom shopping at town square but wanted to have a quick little lunch before hand. I've been sitting here for 40 minutes and have only had my drinks and bread! Not to mention one of the appetizer plates was dirty! And had been used before being given to me!
Anastacia was awesome! She made up for all that has gone wrong today! Our food was great and service excellent!!

Went here right before they closed with some family. The restaurant looked really nice and our server Kevin was a sweetheart. We ordered the hummus to start and then we ordered a Sicilian pizza, Hawaiian pizza and the five cheese pizza. My favorite was definitely the Sicilian. If I'm craving some yummy thin crust pizza, I'll be back!

Our greeter waiter, DAMON IS AMAZING!! Extremely friendly and knowledge about EVERYTHING on the menu. Was not our server but graciously informed us about all his favorites, took our drink and appetizer order. He even went above and beyond and made our favorite drink......the SIDECAR! Perfection in a glass, now onto the GUAC......yummo! I have been to lots i restaurants in town and DAMON's service takes the cake. Thanks Damon!!

Ordered $100+ of food delivery via PostMates.... 1.   I paid $2 extra for shrimp & $2 extra for fish added to my salad & asked to not have the chicken in my salad (I eat seafood but no red meat or chicken /pescetarian)...I got chicken & no fish or shrimp & paid an extra $4 for that  2.  I ordered a full sized salad & it was the equivalent of a half size in the restaurant (I've ordered many times in the restaurant & know the portion sizes) 3.  Ordered 3 pizzas & they were different sizes (2 small & 1 large & they are small enough to begin with). Wtf?  Why were they different sizes?  Also one of pizzas wasn't covered in cheese, you could see the dough blank of anything. 4.   We usually get some bread as we do when we're in the restaurant & I've gotten it when I've picked up my own To Go orders, but not this time (my kids love the bread). 5.   There's no kids menu & my kids were disappointed when the small plate mac & cheese (closest I could find) was some sort of fried cheese ball.  Luckily I also had gotten them pasta dish as well (which was good). The only reason it gets 2 stars is bcz if you go into restaurant it's better as you can ask for corrections & the good does taste good.  But if I'm spending this much on food to be delivered I want the same quality of service.   I eat out/order in food for the family 5/7 days & Cal Pizza Kitchen will no longer be ordered from us & prob won't even go in again bcz of the bad taste of food/service of delivery left in mouth.

Accidentally went to the one at fashion show mall to meet a couple of friends and the customer service was awful. Turns out my friends were at the one at town square and everyone was so friendly. From the host to the manager I was impressed. Our server Jason was fantastic! I would go back just for him.
It has been 10 years since I've been in CPT. They really have skim down on the chicken with their pizza or its just a Vegas thing? ...disappointed :: :0(.

Exactly what I expected from CPK, inflated prices, similar menu to what they had 5-10 years ago, and no attention to detail. My friend started with the wedge salad on the small plates menu. I could see the water dripping off of the lettuce and all the ingredients appeared to be thrown on the plate. Not a good value for almost $6. Next came our entrees, the oriental chicken salad and Hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza. Once again, both dishes did not appear thoughtfully made. My salad contained iceberg lettuce, carrots, cabbage, and chicken the only substantial ingredient. The salad was exactly like a mix from the grocery store. The dressing was fine although a little heavy for the ingredients in the salad. My friend was also underwhelmed with her pizza. Her pizza was soaked in BBQ sauce, it was undercooked, and you could tell the quality of the mozzarella was low by the plastic like texture.  CPK I waited years to give you another try to see if the quality and thoughtfulness of your dishes had improved but I see the price of your food is still too high for the ambiance, quality, and plating of your dishes.

With the ever changing menu at CPK it can be hard to keep up with the newest items and the ones hey have retired. I am a long time CPK customer and always order the same thing when I ordered for pick up (first time) last night, my order was a little mixed up and missing things. I called the store to let her know and ended up speaking with Hailey, the manager on duty. She is unbelievably kind, accommodating and understanding. Completely fixed the mix up and then some!! Hailey fixed what could've been a bad experience and bad review and turned it all around!! Thank you Hailey again you're amazing!
Really great service and yummy food. Even close to closing our sever was chipper and treated us like we were his first table of the night. I would definitely visit this location again!

Good food and reasonable prices. Fast service. We were seated immediately and our order was taken and placed right after we sat down. However , had to wait a bit before receiving our drink order. The Food came out fast and was very good. We did ask to see if the could put the Rams vs. Seahawks football game on Channel 5. She tried to set it up, but was unable to. We were told that they were unable to get the game so they put soccer on instead. Bummer. CPK  is always good.

I was a part of a party of 5 for dinner tonight.   I had stopped in about an hour earlier to check on availability because I have seen how busy this location can be.  Al (the on duty FOH manager?) , suggested that I call about 15 minutes prior to arrival to put our party on a waiting list if necessary. This option proved not to be necessary. Once seated,  Alexia quickly took our drink order, and then our food order.  She was very efficient in bringing out,  then refilling,  our drinks, and bread and oil.  Our entrees came out quickly, too.  It didn't seem like we had to wait very long.  Al was also very helpful in other areas, for which I had sent a comment on the corporate website.

Such a great place to stop by for lunch.  We had a great time today, but I feel the need to warn you guys - don't order the Mahi Mahi Tacos! Blech!  You get two rubbery, fishy rectangular prism fish stick things inside a flavorless tortilla.  No beuno!  But then again, it's not the California Taco Kitchen, so I should have known better :) Everything else was awesome as usual.

California Pizza Chicken... in Nevada!!  (get your own pizza chicken  ....) Went here for my cousins graduation dinner with a party of about 17, and we all ended up sitting outside in the patio, SEPARATELY. It would have been nicer if they could have seated all of us at one big table formed by many little ones, instead separating the whole family. ;( I ended up sitting with my dad and uncle, both who ordered fish tacos while I ordered the wild mushroom pizza. All which came with complimentary bread and oil. Let me cut to the chase: - WILD MUSHROOM PIZZA I was very disappointed after trying this pizza. The crust may have been perfectly soft, but for 13.99? I don't think so. It was not even that good. - FISH TACOS I stole one of my dad's fish taco's and thought they were bomb. The two avocado slices helped finish me off into oblivion. However, the tortilla and fish was a little to dry for me. - BREAD AND OIL All though these were complimentary, I actually enjoyed eating these more than the pizza and tacos. The bread might have been a little too hard on the outside, but it was so dam soft on the inside. Combined with the oil, I would have been fine just eating this instead of the main dishes!! - SERVICE I think something was wrong with our server.. She told me that my pizza will be out "shortly". I soon realized she said that 20 minutes ago. 20 minutes is not short!!!! My uncle also asked for a refill for his beer, which ended up taking 10 minutes to refill -_-. She didn't even apologize!!
This is a great place to eat with you family. Food is quick and good !! Call ahead to put your name on the list to heave a seat when you arrive  at this location almost always a wait .
Hospitality was great. Got a free small appetizer since it was our first visit. Ordered the Sicilian and the works. Both fantastic pizzas with very tasty ingredients. Couldn't ask for much more!

This has always been a favorite for us no matter where we've lived.  We don't go as often as we used to but came here because they sent us a coupon for a free dessert, lol, for my husband's birthday.  We usually get sat in a big, comfortable booth.  They have "small bites" appetizers and we tried the mediterranean focaccia bread.  It's really delicious but they don't give enough of the dipping oil, which would be my only complaint about it.   My husband is disappointed because they got rid of his favorite pizza, the bacon cheeseburger pie.  But he really loves their bolognese sauce and always enjoys his pasta dishes.   The waiter kept our glasses full all dinner long, which is something of a lost art in these parts, haha.  The dessert is the real kicker.  All of their desserts are purely gluttonous and amazing.  We've tried almost all of them but the hidden gem is the butter cake!  How could something so simple be so good?!?  And it's a thousand times better if you get it a la mode.  It's so soft and light it literally melts in your mouth.  Of course my other complaint is that I always leave here feeling like a cow because of how much I ate.  But at least I'm not going hungry!  If you haven't had this for a while I think you should definitely rediscover it because the service and the food are pretty awesome for a chain restaurant!
Nice discovery ! Kitchen was good, friendly service , so many people at this restaurant but just 10 minutes for waiting :-) The desserts menu is too short .

My kids love CPK and when we are at Town Square, that's usually what they ask for.  This time around 5:30 our wait was less than 5 minutes, usually it's around 30. After being seated our waiter arrived, took drinks orders and when he returned, promptly took our food orders. Approximately, 10-15 minutes later our food arrived.  My youngest older a BBQ chicken pizza which she  loves. Older daughter ordered a margarita pizza, I shared it with her along with a chicken Caesar salad. Service and quality has always been consistent in my opinion, and I'm sure we'll return again.

Have been to different CPKs all around town, food is delicious as always. But the service here was terrible!!  First of, there was a wait which was fine, however I saw two people came in after most of us but were seated before us, they were seated right away. I heard the host asked them "Did you want to eat here?" then seated them right away. I don't know what is the whole story with that but even another party looked around like "Why are they getting a table right away?!"  After we were seated the server came up to us immediately and asked for our orders. Everything was find with drink orders and food orders. He told us about the new items and was friendly enough. Our apps came pretty quickly which was nice, when the main courses came, I picked up our empty appetizers plates with the intention of giving the dishes to the food runner because we had no space left on our table, she put the food down on the table and walked away in a rush when I know for a fact that she saw me holding the dirty plates! The plates were huge and the runner was standing right next to me, there was no way that she did not see I was holding the plates, but she just walked away without the picking up the dirty plates. So we stacked the dirty plates to one side ate with very little space, the server eventually came to take the plates away, did not ask us if we needed anything else or how the food was. He did not check in with us at all until it was time for the check.  I have been to this particular CPK a few times before and service was find, but this time it was strange. Maybe they got new employees and needed more training.

My mom, uncle and I had lunch here recently.  We were seated right away and our waitress come over and took drink orders.  She was very good, came by often and brought refills without asking. I had the PEAR + GORGONZOLA pizza - Bosc pears, sweet caramelized onions and hazelnuts, topped with chilled field greens in housemade Gorgonzola ranch. Always my favorite.  Good as ever.  Mom had the PEPPERONI pizza - A combination of rustic and spicy pepperoni with fresh Mozzarella and wild Greek oregano. Always her favorite too. My uncle had the KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI.  It looked tasty but spicy. Lots of hot peppers.   CPK is pretty similar no matter what location you go to.  This one was no exception.  Good food and service.

Pizza taste is great, however could be pricey considering the fact that is pretty small. In my case I can eat more than a half pizza my self, cause is so thin. So if I have to order one by my self , plus salad or pasta and dessert it gets pricey for a non fancy restaurant. There's also better pizza places for lower price. We also tried their summer drink cucumber mojito (non-alcoholic) we didn't like it. The strawberry shortcake was good.  On the other hand, their service is very poor. There was no many people and our server was hard to get, every time we need him. He also never stop by to offer refills or find out if we need anything else, besides when he served our food. He took too long for serving and pizza was already cold by the time it reached our table. I saw him texting on his phone couple of times when I was trying to get his attention.

What's not to love about CPK! A tried and true pizza joint. When I lived in California, I ate at CPK a lot for lunch. So, when I found a CPK out here in Vegas, I just had to go back for more. This location is large with a lot of seating, but there is always a wait to get in on the weekends. The wait is usually about 15-20 mins. This location is conviently located in town square so there is plenty to do while you wait or after dinner.

My worst CPK experience.  We ordered king pao spaghetti, shrimp scampi zucchini fettuccine, egg rolls, and a half buffalo chicken salad.  I am deeply saddened by the protein food portioning.  The flavor is good, but I am convinced that I will no longer be dining at major chains as this was one of the last chains that I loved.  I will add a sad picture of Kung pao spaghetti...unreal experience.  Farewell my long time friend RIP CPK

I haven't been here In about 2 + years, this place has changed a lot since the last time I was here. We split the spinach and artichoke dip and that was good. The chips were nice and salted and the artichoke dip was nice and hot. Then I ordered the California veggie pizza and added avocado and pineapple to it. The avocado didn't come out with it, but the server brought it out on the side. It still looked amazing, however it lacked so much flavor. It tasted as though the veggies were frozen, thawed, and then baked on pizza left with no nutrient or flavor. Not even the red pepper flakes helped my case. But this whole entire meal was made up by our desert, the salted Carmel pudding was amazing, that made the whole entire trip here worth it.
I love the menu here. The food is always good.  I ordered the Santa Fe Power Bowl and I must say it was soooo delicious.  I will definitely be ordering this dish again  service was good too.

Good Pizza for a good price. Just what you're looking for in a restaurant right? I've had better pizza, but it also cost a lot more. I think California Pizza Kitchen has the right balance of quality for price. The dough is just right, and the toppings complement it just right. The atmosphere is a bit higher class, but relaxed as you'd expect from the location, so you're only going to see sharper dressed people there, without everyone being stuck up.

This was the second time I've been to this location and I was very content with my trip. The wait for my friend and I was less than 5 minutes (on a Friday night at 7PM PST). We both started out with drinks and the chicken lettuce wrap appetizers. When I tell y'all I ALWAYS get this appetizer, I'm not kidding. It's something light, tangy, crunchy and something I look forward to ordering when I come here. For dinner, my friend and I both shared the Wild Mushroom Pizza. If you are a mushroom lover, this pizza is def for you. Thin crust, wonderful cheese ratio and the meatiness from the different mushrooms really make this pizza. We decided to get dessert and ordered the chocolate cake (sorry I can't remember the full name!!) with ice cream. It's really chocolaty, so if you don't mind that, this dessert is perfect for you

Ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza...very disappointing. ..small amount of sauce..vegetables (carrots, cilantro, scallion) were all dry and appeared to be day or two old. Called the Manager's attention who explained that the old recipe has been changed and that next time we order, ask for the original recipe. Gave us a "please return card" for $15.

I've been to this location numerous times but this time, my dining experience exceeded my expectations. Kevin, our awesome server, was spot on with keeping us in the know of every little thing...from getting my son a refill to the specials and entrees to our liking. We need more people like Kevin...makes the food taste a million times better.

I've been to this California Pizza Kitchen on a few different occasions and I'm usually left noticing that the food isn't as consistent with other locations and that the service is usually lacking.  Slow with refills and last time we were there they forgot all about my to go box and I had to remind her to bring it back. Luckily she forgot it on a shelf near the cash register.

We have eaten here a few times.  Service was always good. We had a server named Katie twice in a row and loved having her take care of us.  I can say my favorite dish hands down is the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti. I have had it twice now and is just amazingly delicious. The wife is gluten free and said the crust is delicious. She gave me a piece and I can say, it is pretty good. (I love my regular crust loaded with gluten!) We will continue to go there for the service and quality of food.

The service we received from Jasmyn tonight was amazing. She was so attentive and constantly exceeded our expectations for service. Our food came out timely and tasted delicious. We didn't feel pressured or rushed, which was refreshing. She gave dish suggestions that truly showed her knowledge of the menu. A member of our party had a birthday, and she brought a delicious dessert for her to enjoy as a surprise. I haven't received this caliber of service in so long, and I really appreciate Jasmyn. Thank you!

Wow. This server was AMAZINGGGGGGGGGG. Boyfriend and I decided to give CPK a 2nd chance because we were in the area. This has got to be the BEST experience at cpk...ever. And we've been here plenty of times.  We ordered fire grilled rib eye, bianco, and chicken tequila fettuccini. The fettuccini with rib eye combo compliments eachother really well. The waiter name is Kyle and he recommended all to us. Let me tell you, this is the FIRST TIME that a waiter asked me "hows the food" and I respond with "amazing."  Everything just went great with eachother. The sage on the bianco brought great flavors, the citric taste from the tequila fettuccini together with the rib eye, mannnn. I use to find this place mediocre.  On top of this, great service. Server came by many times to check up on us. He even made us laugh a few times. Man 5/5 !  :) would come again only on days when this server is working LOL

Horrible! Food did not taste as it should have. My quinoa salad hardly had any quinoa, the pizza was extra grease/oily. The sandwiches were not very good either. (I've ordered this before I know what it tastes like). Our waitress was nice but she took a very long time to take our order. Also the place was quite empty yet it took forever to get our food. At one point there were more employees than customers and they were just hanging around doing nothing. To top it off when we got up to leave we saw our waitress had been sitting and eating with some other employees at the table behind ours!!
The hostess didn't have any facial expression, when we asked if we could switch tables she said "yeah sure" like it was a big inconvenience to her

We went to the take out door to order a gluten free bbq chicken pizza. The service and wait time were fine, but the pizza itself was bloody awful! The gluten free crust was soft and spongy and tasted so terrible. Probably 4 tiny pieces of chicken, hardly any sauce and a few onions. So many other pizza places to get a great gluten free pizza, this is not the place!!!

I thought I was ordering a delicious strawberry shortcake but what I got was entirely different... When my waiter brought out the dessert it was how you say different then the advertising. It looked like cornbread had been fried with mushy, lemon tasting strawberries on top. Would not recommend if you like appetizing food. One word: disappointed.
Tyler is the best server I've ever had here.  The past two times we've been here we've had him and his humor and attention to detail really makes a big difference on our stay

Manny is the man! The bbq chicken pizza and chicken tequila pasta are to die for! Will be coming back, thank you again sir for the wonderful experience! - signed " the kid who talked to you about the $3000 fridge "

It's busy, service is always slow even though there's plenty of waiters running around and the food is just average. Since they remodeled there seems to be less seating. I ordered the kale salad there wasn't much kale at all.

Doesn't even deserve 1 star but since Yelp won't let me post without clicking at least one here goes. CPK should be ashamed of themselves!!! Food was t even cooked to menu descriptions!!! Service was horrific!!! Waitress never came by the table to check on us after food arrived!! Waited and waited finally asked where she was and no one knows!! So very disappointed as I took out of state visitors who had never been to a CPK before and never will be again!!!!!
The service was amazing. The food ok. The service was slow which was sad because it wasn't busy. I had the pizza lunch special snd it was a good value. It wasn't anything to exciting just lunch.

I work in Town Square and stopped by CPK to grab a to-go order. The girls helping me were friendly, fast, and thorough. My salad is delicious (Thai crunch) everything tastes so fresh and they even allowed me to sub no chicken add avocado at no extra price - which is above and beyond awesome - most places won't let you. The name on my receipt says that Chelsea helped me. I'm definitely a satisfied customer, thank you!

When I used to visit California as a child we would go to CPK and get the Italian pizza - which was my favorite. So, recently we went to CPK and I obviously ordered the Italian pizza and it was nothing like I remember it. Total bummer - I still give 3 stars since the rest of the pizzas I tried were good, but what happened to the italian....

Just had dinner at CPK and my server Kevin was so awesome we asked to speak with the manager to make him aware of the service that we received .  This gentleman made the pizza we ordered taste better than we expected.  So if anyone goes there please ask for Kevin and you will see what we are talking about .

Today my mom and I have experienced the most pleasurable eating experience of our lives! Our server Antonio did such an amazing job at making sure we were okay and checked up on us at right appropriate times. We did not feel overwhelmed or rushed either which is always nice. The service was incredible and it was great to see all the staff work as a TEAM! :) Our food in turn came out just as delicious!!! My mom got the Pesto Cream Penne which she said was not drowning in too much sauce and she pretty much devoured it all! I had the Fish Tacos w/ avacado which, by the way I can see why it is a CPK favorite! Just the right amount fish and it came with salsa and chips. Boy, that was mouth watering! We also enjoyed a couple of drinks along with our meals. To be specific mango mojito, strawberry mango cooler and a strawberry rhubarb martini and whoever the bartender is THANK YOU! Drinks were not over powering but tasted flavorful! We ended the meal with this amazing butter cake!!!! Off the chain....no joke its just the right amount of decadent w/ a hint of deadly ;)  Overall, such a great afternoon and the ability of the staff to work as a team and smiles all around really reflected upon the food which was beyond amazing :) We also got to meet the manager Haley who was super delightful! You have return customers for sure CPK!! :)

I worked at CPK in 1987. I'm a fan and very familiar with their menu. Calling this place and getting the take out girl on the phone was enough to break glass, the girl's whiny fake voice is unbearable. I ordered a salad SPECIFICALLY to include bread, and as per expected with this world of 0.0 attention span of those under 25, there was no bread.  When I inform her that I asked for bread, she has no reaction at all, and when I say the word "that I specifically" asked, she is taken back because she now knows that I know it was her who took my order and it was she who screwed up and tried to lie about it. These people need to be trained that a customer has an "experience" when they come to your business.  That experience begins finding parking, who greets them at the door, etc, etc. How likely am I to order take out again, knowing that the person who answers the phone doesn't pay attention, and doesn't care that she doesn't. It wasn't that it happened, it's that she didn't care that she screwed up. It was her attitude, and her mouth, and her body language.

I used to work for this company for many many years. One thing that never changes is my love for the food that is made here. Avocado eggrolls, baja/Thai rolls, spin dip with pita as the best apps ever, not just from here but any chain. You can't beat the flavor and quality of those ones. Yes, this is a pizza place. But we come here for the salads. Great portions for a great price. If you haven't had the roasted veggie salad with grilled chicken you are not living life! Also the Thai crunch salad is probably one of the best salads out there, you need avocado on this one to fully bring it to realization but you'll really enjoy it if you're into peanuts. Many other places make Amazon BBQ chicken salads, but this is the place that gave everyone the opportunity to sell them. Get the salad if you're into originals. The Sicilian pizza with extra sauce and Serrano peppers until death and the chicken and shrimp marinara pasta will forever be my one love (unless the broccoli fusilli comes back) CPK is a part of my soul. I love this restaurant.The food here will forever take me to a time frame of my life that I truly valued and enjoyed for this is my favorite place to eat. Ever.

I've been coming to this CPK ever since it first opened, which was when Town Square first opened. Granted, I don't go THAT often but on and off -- usually with friends or family. I typically prefer this location over the one at Fashion Show Mall only because I hate venturing towards the direction of the strip. Not only that but this location is bigger.  However, I don't have a single memory of exceptional service from this establishment. Not once in the amount of odd years it's been around. In fact, I remember one time, when I went with friends, no one came to our table for a LONG while (not even for drink orders) so what did we do? Build a fort out of the menus. I know, we were so immature but funny thing was, that didn't get their attention.  I just recently came back to dine at this establishment with my family after being away from Las Vegas for three years, and I gotta say... the service certainly hasn't improved. I gotta admit, it's not as busy as it used to be, but it still took a LONG while for any server to acknowledge our existence after we got seated. There was nothing wrong with the hostess, but there was something wrong with the waitresses. I think it took so long that ANOTHER waitress that wasn't OUR waitress came to take our orders because no one else helped us. Which caused a little confusion later on when the food arrived.  Other than that, everything else went fine. After we got our food, we were happy campers.  Speaking of the food, it is pretty on point. It's pretty good. One of my favorite is their bolognese pasta. Sometimes I like to ask for them to make it spicy, in which they add pepper flakes to the pasta. Always turns out yummy. The garlic cream fettuccine is also another favorite of mine but sometimes, the flavor can be so-so. Oh, their tiramisu never disappoints either :)  Not a bad place. Not a fabulous place. Still great to eat at with family and friends when you want some CPK. Gotta have patience though.

After visiting The container Store for a longer span of time than we thought we would, it was high time for dinner.  Eyeballing the several offerings of Town Square, we came across this California Pizza Kitchen.  There was a wait everywhere on this Friday night, but here it didn't appear to be intolerable.  So, we put in our name and waited to be called.  After about 20 minutes the lights on our pager finally glowed red and danced about.  Now hungrier than ever, we prepared to settle in our comfortable booth and enjoy a multi-course dinner at a relaxed pace.  We were not ready to rumble, but to EAT! So, I began with Minced Chicken Lettuce Wraps, while Diane looked forward to an opening side of Traditional Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese.  The Lettuce Wraps were excellent, featuring fine chicken, tiny curved water chestnuts, jalapeno circles, very fresh and crisp lettuce leaves, and a nice soy-based spicy dipping sauce.  I did find though that the Cherry Limeade I also ordered was too strong for my taste. The Mac 'N' Cheese had an excellent crisp crust, and was firm on the inside--not mushy.  The whole dish was quite yummy. Unfortunately our Garlic Cream Fettuccine entrees then arrived right on top of our starters.  I sent mine back, but Diane accepted hers, which contained sauteed chicken and shrimp.  When my entree arrived again at a more suitable time, it was just like Diane's, except mine was further enhanced by sauteed mushrooms.  The sauteing was first-rate, the fettuccine was al dente, and just enough Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce clung to the pasta to make this a truly delectable dish.  The portions were large, with an ample amount of chicken breast chunks and medium- to large-sized shrimps.  We both enjoyed our hot entrees immensely. But how is a fine dinner truly complete without a sumptuous dessert?  So, I finished with a towering slice of 6-layer Lemon Cake with Lemon Custard Filling, while Diane dug into a large slice of 5-layer Red Velvet Cake.  My high-caloric sweet treat was brushed with Limoncello, candied lemon zest, and Mascarpone Frosting, and was very lemony and delicious.  Diane's was topped by a creamy and very tasty Cream Cheese Frosting.  We were both in dessert nirvana. One other service delay must be mentioned.  Diane seemed to wait forever for a Hot Chocolate.  We were ultimately told by both our server and the manager that the bartender on duty makes all Hot Chocolate drinks, and got behind making that and other ordered drinks.  Finally, the manager hustled over to our table with the Hot Chocolate way late, but did take it off the bill.  And then Diane found it to be too thin. Even though our dining experience was marred by two service errors, the food was so delicious that we just brushed these minor inconveniences aside, and this outing still rated an overall 4-1/2 stars!
What else can you say... Food,  service and atmosphere is top notch for a chain restaurant.

Normally. I have good experiences at California Pizza Kitchen, but the service experienced on 10/1 at this location was horrendous. Apparently, we had just missed a big rush since it was homecoming weekend for one of the high schools. We got there as the rush ended, and we're seated within 10 minutes.  Our server started out friendly and talkative at first. But as time progressed, the service went downhill. It took at least 15 min for us to get our appetizer, and then about 45 minutes to get our pizza. Not only that,  but the server never apologized for how long it was taking for our food to come out. I noticed another table of 5 (compared to our 2) had ordered the same appetizer, and received it quicker than we did. Hummus shouldn't take 15 minutes. Also, once we got the pizza,  the server made sure that it was not made with wheat since that's what I'm allergic to...however....I found it very odd that he said he made our pizza himself. Once we were ready for our check,  the process took another 10 to 15 minutes since we didn't know where our server was, and we had to ask someone else if we could have our check. Our server seemed to be in lala land. I used to be a server myself, and had the service been 20% better, the server probably would have received a better tip, and not $2, and I wouldn't be taking my business elsewhere due to the lack of customer service at this restaurant. I gave this place 2 stars because while the service was horrendous, the food was still good. But I probably won't be back here based on the service received.

Went during lunch. I was expecting it to be busy. We waited 15mins for a table which wasn't bad at all. Once we sat down. Service was horrible. It took forever to get our drinks. Took even longer to get our food. There were people that sat after us, got their food, paid, and left while we were waiting for our order.  Don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.

I ate here two days ago with my boyfriend. One of my go to places to eat when I want pizza other than dominos or Pizza Hut. The reason I gave 5 stars because our service was awesome. Tiffany was her name, she was super super sweet and energetic. She seemed to enjoy her job, which now days is hard to find. A lot of the places I eat good service is Hard to find. To me service is a big part of you meal as well. I work in the industry so I know what I expect. Our food was good  too. I got the Avocado Wonton rolls, my fave. And Chipotle Chicken Pizza. Along with the Caribbean Sangria! SO good and refreshing!

My team and I had a luncheon here on a day when California Pizza Kitchens (CPKs) had a special promotion to benefit a local charity (check out those Yelp event listings!)  So, I didn't feel as guilty indulging in a carb fest, knowing that we were giving back to our community.  PIZZAS The Original BBQ Chicken (original hand tossed): I'm confident that I can eat this single-handedly. BBQ chicken + GOUDA CHEESE on pizza as a perfect combo and completely threw me off. It has just the right amount of sweet and savory flavors. Wild Mushroom (original hand tossed): I love mushrooms on my pizza, but this was practically bland. We didn't order the white truffle oil, which might've added that missing flavor factor. I'm not saying the pizza wasn't good, but it didn't stand out among the others.  Margherita (thin crust): Simple and delicious. I loved the cheesy, stringy Mozzarella, but I wasn't a fan of the crust. Despite that, the pie was a hit.  DESSERT Belgian Chocolate Souffle Cake: Warm, rich and fudgy, and it's served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!  SERVICE Great. Make reservations ahead of time. The place was busy during lunch, but our server and her team went above and beyond with taking care of my table's needs. Shout out to Jesse, the GM, who also did an awesome job ensuring that we were enjoying our experience. OVERALL I may have to return in the future to try some of their more interesting pizza creations.

We came for a date night around 7pm on a Tuesday night. So obviously it wasn't busy, there was only people at the booths- no tables. They warned us they were in construction and they were sorry the floors were tore up. It didn't bother us though, no construction was being done at that time!  On to the food! We ordered spinach and artichoke dip for appetizers and we finished it right before our food arrived. It's sad I was pleasantly surprised by this because half the time they come out with the food! The chips seemed a little stale but the dip was amazing, it wasn't chunky which I enjoyed better. We than shared mahi mahi tacos (with avocado $1.25 more) and a thin crust three meat pizza. The mahi mahi tacos were huge and very delicious, the avocado was also perfect! The pizza was a little spicy and we liked all the meat it had to offer!!  Side note if you sign up for their rewards on your next visit you get a free small plate. I signed up on the spot and now it shows I have a free small plate and $10 off of $40! Pretty awesome and we will be back Friday with our little one!

We got the Chicken Club Salad....Tomato Full size pizza...I think 3 Cheese Pizza.  Anyway...I would eat here everyday...We normally drink water...Save the Money for a Tip......This Pizza was Amazing!!!!   Salad Too!  Keep up the great Work!

Came in with my son for dinner tonight. Love coming here, they have amazing food, amazing drinks and love their artichoke spinach dip Only thing that killed our experience was our server Brian Christopher. Absolutely horrible. Would forget multiple times to refill water when he would ask himself if we needed any. Poor attitude all around looked like he didnt want to work at all! Definitely making sure i dont get him ever again. Other than that lovely all around !
