Everyone was super nice! We walked in and the hostesses greeted us immediately with warmth and smiles. We were seated right a way. Looking around it was very clean and modern. Lots of seating.  Our server asked if we had ever been here before. We said no. I ordered a mojito and it was really good and refreshing. We both had a pizza each. My friend got the carnitas pizza sooo good! And I had the Hawaiian. It was good but too much green stuff on top. I think it was shredded green onion, not sure but I pulled most of it off. We had the Thai spring rolls (2) ok those were interesting in a good way. Loved the peanut dip that came with them. They were more of a taquito than a spring roll. Rolled up in a flower tortilla.  The manager visited our table prior to our food coming and after the bread olive oil arrived. She gave us one of the new flat breads. It was all cheese and some sage. It was interesting. Tasted like nachos for some reason. I can't stand sage. So it isn't something I would order. But it was free food so you know I ate it! With all the appetizers I was soooo full that I ate only two pieces of my pizza. Then had to go back to work and smell pizza until I got home and at it for dinner

Came in late for a light dinner after a long walk around Town Square. The staff was great and food was delicious. Perfect portions. I asked about the wifi there, the signal was terrible. I wasn't to worried about the internet as I was having an evening with my wife but the wifi is important for large crowds. Overall the food and atmosphere was was great.

My husband and I had a very pleasant experience here last week. We had been walking around Town Square for awhile and became a little tired and hungry. Pizza sounded good to us, so we ended up here at CPK.  Our hostess was good about getting our drinks started right away. She answered all of our questions in a prompt and friendly manner. She was also really attentive about refilling our drinks. We ordered a pizza, half California Club, and half the Works. Please keep in mind that these pizzas are medium-sized, so you get 6 slices total. My husband had the Works: a take on supreme pizza. He liked it, but wasn't wowed by it. I had the California Club and I cannot express in words how good it was! It comes with bacon, cheese, romaine tossed in lemon pepper mayonnaise, and it is topped with avocado. The avocado and romaine were super fresh and the lemon pepper mayonnaise was the bomb! I liked it so much that as soon as I got home from the restaurant, I searched for a recipe for it with no avail, unfortunately. Hahaha.  Great service and good food. I'll be back if I find myself in the area again.
Great service from our server Jason! Very friendly and family orientated man! He engaged with not only us but our children!

It has been a Very Long Time since I last ate at a CPK, I decided to go there since I was in the area with my Sister & her Family! Everything was On Point. Got Seated Right Away, The Waiter was Very Pleasant, and He was Prompt when It came to our Drinks, and our Lunch! I had No Complaints about my Lunch ( Garlic Pasta Alfredo with Shrimp) Very Tasty and, Hot! My Sister & and her Family All Enjoyed their Lunch as well!  This CPK is located in Town Square Shopping Plaza, Right in the Middle, Between Whole Foods, and The Container Store. Of Course there was a lot of Parking, I believe I even saw some Bike Racks as well! Restrooms were Clean, and I Forgot to Mention, the Manager also came by the Tables to See if there were any Problems, and if our Lunches were alright!  Would I Go Back? Of Course I would!  =)

Came here while on vacation. It was my first time at this particular location, but I've been to CPK many times in the past. I ordered my usual-a Thai chicken pizza, BBQ chicken chopped salad, and the side by side soup with smashed pea and tortilla. The pizza was drenched in bean sprouts and carrots. I know that's part of the topping, but I've never seen them put so much. It really overpowered the pizza and made it soggy. The salad didn't have enough dressing and I paid extra for avocado which came with 4 tiny pieces. The soup was cold when it was served. Only good thing was the service, hence the 2 stars.  Btw, I came in an hour before closing.
Love their menus , so tasty last time I tried the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti and I love it , try it with red wine or Amareta sour cocktail you will like it ) one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas

Soups are all great. Try the harvest vegetable. Don't go often but when we do the food is always great. We waited FOREVER the last time we went though. And when we finally sat down it took over 35mins to get our food. All this just at lunch

This is the place for a variety of pizza plus choices of salads, soups, appetizers, drinks, and dessert all while in a very family friendly environment. I feel this place is big enough to serve large families, but there are also more secluded places for a quiet meal.  There is the bar where all the action happens- tv and the oven can be your entertainment. Yes, CPK is a chain, but a great place at TS to stop in and know your children in the stroller are welcome and also it won't break the bank.  Service has always been eager and friendly to help you have a positive dining experience.  Don't forget they have to to go option as well.  I have yet to eat out on the patio,but that may be the place for a more quiet meal.  They do have some lighter menu items for the health conscious which is always good.  Food has been consistent the handful of times that I have eaten here. It tastes how the menu describes it and how the picture looks.  So next time you are hungry after shopping or need to kill some time before the movie- stop by CPK.
Our waiter Kevin was really nice. Not to mention he was cute as well :) but anyway, he always came to check on us if we were okay.  Food was good as always :)  Good CPK location

Every time I come in here I ask myself why? As I'm looking at the menu I start thinking what other restaurants have better options. I usually try to avoid this restaurant unless it's the one in downtown summerlin. Well I had no choice this last time. I met up with some friends and they all voted for CPK. I tried to stay positive and go with the flow. We go in and are told it'll be at least twenty five minutes. Since there isn't much space to wait and we all had our kids, we decided to go to the Disney art store for a bit.         Once we returned we were automatically seated. The waitress seemed friendly and greeted us within a few minutes, but ordering food and drinks is where the problem came in. She took our drink order and after ten minutes they finally arrived (one alcoholic beverage and three waters). She then comes to take our order and we request if she'll return in one minute. Ten minutes later she returns again. So my friends all order pizza and I order the chicken tequila pasta. Close to 30 minutes later a server brings out the pizza and asked if I ordered anything. I told him I ordered the pasta and all of a sudden he looked really nervous. I was pretty hungry and trying not to over react (I take my food very seriously, it's not that hard to get an order right). The waitress came to us and admitted that my meal was sent to the wrong take and the person at the table already started eating it. She apologized and said she put another order in. When the my pasta came out she was genuinely apologetic. By the end of the meal, she said she took my meal of the tab. I really appreciate restaurants that make mistakes and own up to it, not just make a pathetic excuse and just say sorry. My problem is that this location always messes something up when I come in. Maybe I have a stamp on my head that says "mess up his order" or maybe their job is really that hard? The one think I do know, I'll probably not be returning to this location. The end.

Slow service, not the greatest pizza.   We used to go to CPK on a regular basis, but they seem to be going downhill.  We try every so often, trying to remain optimistic.  After our last meal, will be a while before we return. Service was quite slow, as took quite a while to get the drinks out, and we had to find the server to get refills.  The pizza had very little taste.  Not sure if the crust was overcooked, or just little taste.  Pizza also took forever to come out.  Considering the premium price of their pizzas, I just can't see returning unless we start hearing some positives.

Came in to have dinner with my son, my first time there, food is ok, we were satisfied with our meals. What really had me impressed was the good mood every employee there was in, from the moment we came in to the moment we left. It was scary almost how positive and in sync everyone was, so bravo to them because I know how tough it is to stay full of energy and up beat on a busy Friday night.

I don't have a review for CPK yet?? Oh no, gotta change that. Their Townsquare location is the main one I visit since it's the closest to home and since Townsquare always has a nice feel with all the trees and everything. Let's start with service, sometimes it's a hit or miss with the servers but generally pretty good. One thing that they're really good at is keeping wait times low even though it gets crazy. Onto the food! I've loved everything I've tried here except for their Jambalaya Pasta. That dish scarred me Lol idk if they made it wrong or something but that just had a horrible flavor. I had my boyfriend taste it too and he said it was pretty bad Lol. But thankfully that's the only bad thing I've had. My current favorites are the Avocado Club Eggrolls, Cedar Plank Salmon, Tequila Fettucine, Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza & Pear/Gorgonzola Pizza on Hand-Tossed Crust. I'm not a fan of thin crust at all so I'm happy that they can make any of the thin-crust pizzas on regular hand-tossed. Now their Butter Cake with Haagen Daaz ice cream deserves it's own paragraph. Oh my Goodness. I remember the first time being introduced to it, We wanted a dessert but didn't know which one to go with and our waitress was like, "You're not true CPK Fans till you've given our Butter Cake a try." This cake is life changing lmao. Super warm and soft and sweet but not too sweet. It's a little hard to describe the flavors but whatever you do, just get it. I've also ordered to-go many times and everytime, the pizza, salads, etc were all the same quality as you would get dining there. They're also really amazing at giving utensils, napkins, fresh bread, and parmesan/hot pepper flakes without even asking!  Forever a regular!

When we walked in we were kindly greeted by the host at the door! Then our waiter Jason done an outstanding job and was very kind to our children! He also had four children of his own so you know how to deal with them! And also complimented us on how very well-behaved our children were! It was also a great waiter and done a great job! We loved our food although I wasn't a big fan of the pizza our experience was still great!

The food at this place was good. The reason I'm giving the 5 stars is for the service. When we walked in the host was very friendly. Our server, Kevin was absolutely amazing. He was so friendly, attentive, and just on it. I have to say this guy would be a great server in a 5 star restaurant, he was so pleasant. It is so hard to find such a great server these days. I am so impressed, because rarely do I get this great of service. Thank you Kevin, I will definitely be back and request to sit in his station.

Second chance for CPK, this time at Town Square. The first try at Fashion Show  was disastrous. This location rocked!!! Angie took great care of us!! Food was awesome (now that we got the right dish) Angie saved it!!! Be sure to sit at the counter so Angie can take care of you. A big kudos to manager Jesse for going above and beyond to make sure this was a better experience for us. Best location by FAR!!!

Why is the service here so bad? Even for takeout orders, I was standing waiting for service for 5 minutes while employees chatted and did other things. I wouldn't go here again based on the sad ass service.

I must say:  Pleasantly Surprised!  I enjoyed this one even more so than the one located in the Mirage Hotel. They now have a 'low calorie' menu, it's definitely more pricey than their other menu, but sometimes you have to pay not to be tempted.  You can go online and download a full and comprehensive caloric menu from their website.  For instance, ordering the pizza thin crust makes a pretty big difference. Our server was very bubbly and attentive, she was their corporate trainer based on the pin on her lapel, dark hair really cute glasses.  They have 1/2 salads and full portions too, which is nice. I ordered the under 500 calorie shrimp scampi zucchini pasta--I loved it. Especially for being healthy. It had tons of garlic and a lot of flavor. I added spinach and roasted red peppers to it for some more veggies. I'm going to try and replicate it at home. It was very very good. My friend ordered lettuce wraps [chicken and shrimp which somehow has more calories & fat than just the chicken or just the shrimp? which is confusing but whatever] she ate 'em up. Her husband ordered a 1/2 salad which he finished in it's entirety and then managed to eat a couple of her lettuce wraps. Food took a little longer than I would've liked to come out, but it was very busy. Would also love if they served some pizza bread for a starter [even though that is not on the diet].  1/2 salad & 1/2 pizza option would be very nice too. Music was very loungey this time I felt like I was in a nightclub, kind of techno funky was unusual but I didn't mind it. I also took out a to-go order for one of our co-workers, when I was walking out the manager basically bolted to open the door for me [and he was in mid discussion with the hostess]. I *love*  men with manners. A+

How the Hell do you call yourself a Pizza Place by not having Create your Own Pizza????  Also, Charging $6 for a Flipping 18 OZ Sam Adams????  Come On People, Get Real, This is Horse Manure!!!!  The Wifi is slowwwwwww........
Excellent food and drinks. The best server is KEVIN! He was awesome. Very energetic, knew the menu, suggested off the hook drinks. He really took care of us!!!

Damon. One word to describe California Pizza. He is a fantastic waiter. He was kind, very helpful and has a great attitude. California Pizza is lucky to have him. Great waiters are not always easy to find. While he was at our table, another customer came up to him to thank him for great service. Good show Damon.

This is the best California pizza kitchen. I've been twice to the one in fashion show and it's not as good. This location is perfect. Had this time Candance as the server, and she is great, was also great with the kids. She knows her menu.

We came here for a fast meal before a movie. My wife and I each ordered a salad (it was really hot outside so not a good day for pizza). They have a small plates menu. I got a wedge.It was more than I counted on as a small plate. Absolutely delish. I also got a small plates flat bread (spinach and artichoke). Really good!
I had great customer service today at the Town Square location with Aubrey. She was very sweet and helpful. I will definitely be back for the customer service and the food. :)

After many years of going to various CPK locations these places bore me. They are consistent, clean and efficient and I give them points for that. It is straightforward food that lacks any memorable qualities. Had the Thai Chicken Salad. Fresh, crunchy cabbage. The chicken portion was extremely small. Lightly dressed which was healthier but not as tasty as I remember.

Had a business lunch here today with a couple of other Freedom-preneurs as we masterminded how to take over the city.   This was my first time at CPK but loved it!!  I'll be back Although the place was busy, we got excellent service from Aaron.   One of our party was late and Aaron was very patient and kept our drinks filled.  One of us had a small child (2 years old) and Aaron was very sweet and funny with her.   The food was AWEsome (Hawaiian Pizza for me) came out fresh , hot and very tasty.  Love the location in Town Square and had I had more time, I'd have been looking around at all the great stores there.   If you are down in or around the strip area, enjoy pizza, pasta, etc.  This is your place.   Have the most awesome incredible dessert too.  Enjoyed very much!!
CPK is a chain restaurant- so you know what you are getting.... this location has great service, a clean restaurant and I have always had a great experience here!

Went to CPK for lunch at Town Square. This was my second visit to this location. Just as the first, overall experience was great. Restaurant had a nice open atmosphere, staff was attentive and courteous. Food tasted great and worth every penny. Two appetizers, pizza, and dessert for less than $40! I rate food based on whether or not I can make it better at home. I couldn't have done better, so good job CPK. If your at Las Vegas Town Square, you can't go wrong with CPK.

Only been here twice and both times had the California Avocado Egg Rolls. Crispy open-end rolls with filling of diced, grilled chicken, diced tomatoes, avocado chunks, and bits of bacon. Two dipping sauces--I liked the Ranch. These appetizers are delicious and more than enough as a meal for one.

Had a great experience at CPK last night. Took company from out if town (there were 9 in our party). The food was good & the service was excellent. Our server, Miguel, was the best. Another great experience last night, Had 10 people on our group. It had been 3 weeks since our last visit & we had the same great waiter, Miguel. He remembered us & knew what my husband wanted to drink. Now, that's service.

Tonights (Veteran's Day) trip to CPK was very good. Although it was very loud, the food that hit the table was excellent. The hummus was tasty and the spinach artichoke dip was acceptable. The first round of beverages were returned, for being flat. We were assured the CO2 was in working order, but second round of drinks were just as flat. Barbecue Chicken (with bacon and pineapple!) pizza as well as the Wild Mushroom were top notch. The Caesar Salad had a nice spice and the Chinese Chicken salad had the right amount of zing and crunch. Special thank you to our server Manni- he was very attentive and friendly.

This is my favorite location! Service and atmosphere is average, nothing wrong with that. We always come here before or after a movie. My boyfriend knows the usual, we start off with the avocado egg rolls (anything with bacon is amazing), Thai crunch salad gives a good balance to what we share, and the chefs make the best jambalaya (crawfish included yum!). We get the spicy buffalo chicken or meat lovers pizza when we're feeling hungry&bold. These plates are pretty big and perfect to share, especially when you're with your love ones (limit to one plate, BORING!). I recommend signing up for the CPK rewards point system, rack up points even  if you don't come often, get free treats or small plates.
Best avocado rolls ever!!! Love the Kung pro spaghetti .. Not a long wait love the atmosphere.. Highly recommended

SO having gone almost 2 years without this place I was happy to be back at CPK Easter Saturday and my word the must try: Avocado eggs rolls appetizer ! gently fried, melted cheeses , bacon , diced chicken breast, tomato's  and of course avocado!! served with mild and spicy ranch are thee best!!! be careful eating too many there's zero room for the main course, after the bread and herb oil then these babies , that oh so right BBQ chicken pizza will be heading off to takemehomeland.

Gave them 5 stars because I have absolutely nothing to complain about. First time I came here was for a special dinner for one of my coworker. We had roughly 25 people there. The waiter was extremely nice and patient with us which I really appreciate because I know with so many of us in one group we were really loud and needy haha. He constantly kept our waters filled and our bread coming. The free bread they give there with a side of butter and dipping oil they serve is so good he served us three rounds! Overall the service was great and the food was even better. I've only tried the Hawaiian pizza and the Habanero carnitas pizza but from the quality of both I am looking to trying out the rest of their menu. My favorite is the habanero carnitas and I've been craving it ever since. I am in love haha
What an amazing experience. It was moms birthday and she caught on. Unexpectedly she brought out something sweet just for her. I cannot wait to come back.

This place seems to keep going downhill from when we first started going there.  It's in the Town Square shopping area on the strip.  For the money this is not a good bargain place to eat.  Ordered a pasta dish and added chicken.  Very little chicken and very little sauce on the pasta as well.  There was probably only 3 or 4 oz of meat in the pasta for which they charged extra for.  They continually remove favorite items from the menu and now on this last visit I was told no more Tiramisu for desert starting next month.   Another Las Vegas restaurant gets added to my S@#t list and I will look elsewhere to dine.

I took a very special 85 year old lady to dinner with my partner and our friend , so the four of us had to wait for a table we cruised up to the bar and met Mani the bartender he was sweet to us so we chose to eat at the bar we had a wonderful dinner everything was superb and presented beautifully !! affordable quality at its best !!    Thank you mani Flo loves you now !! we will be back !!!
Great experience, four cheese ravioli is where it's at. Along with the "trust me its good" butter cake . The best by far for pasta compared to brio and even olive garden.
Had lunch here while we were in Vegas. Good food, fast service. We don't have one of these where we live.  So I eat at one when we have a chance.

I have never really had a bad experience at any CPK location.  This place didn't disappoint.  Only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because there is always a wait here.  But it's in a busy area so I accept it.  I just wish it didn't have a wait.  The prices are the same and food is consistent.  I love there salads and appetizers here. This is a great place for you and your friends to come in have a few drinks and appetizers then go shopping around at Town Square.  Great family atmosphere.  The staff is really nice and always polite. One time the staff gave me a free velvet cake because of the wait.  Didn't expect that and it was a pleasant surprise.

Came here with coworkers for lunch today. Waited 10mins to sit down, ordered 3 pizzas, CA club, Ca veggie and Sicilian. They are all good, perfect amount for 5 ppl,$50 before tips.  The whole lunch took about 1hour and 15mins. It took about 15-20mins to get our good, I guess they are really busy.

I want to start off by saying I have eaten at many California Pizza locations, but for some reason this one was wildly different than others.  The sauce was oily and runny, the crust was overcooked, and it seemed almost too thin.  The toppings didn't seem fresh either.  I can't imagine all their pizza is like this but I won't be heading back to this location again.

I have a lunch date with my mother every Saturday afternoon and we decided on CPK so we could do some shopping at TS after lunch last Saturday.. I hadn't been to CPK in forever and the only location I've ever been to is the one at Fashion Show. We arrived at 3:30 and surprisingly the place was full and there was a 15 minute wait.   This place reminded me of Chuckie Cheese with all the kids everywhere. LOL I much prefer the atmosphere at the Fashion Show location. Everything here just seemed kind of cheap even the napkins... & I swear I remember the food tasting much better. -Mango Sangria: Reminded me of Mexican candy which I happen to like haha but there were only 3 pieces of fruit in there and I couldn't even taste any wine/alcohol..  -Grilled Peaches & Shrimp Salad: Loved this salad!!! Tangy dressing and fresh field greens.. Shrimp were small though.  -Wild mushroom Pizza with chicken: This used to me my favorite pizza. I feel like there used to be more mushrooms with stronger flavors. The crust used to be perfect and kind of sweet. -Jambalaya Pasta: It was too spicy/peppery for me. I prefer Cheesecake Factory's version..  -Complimentary bread: Wasn't even warm & the butter was ice cold.   Service was friendly. I just think with so many other options at TS.. California Pizza Kitchen doesn't stand out. & if I really wanted their pizza I could get it in the frozen aisle at the grocery store.  HOT TIP: Go on their website for a $5 off coupon~!!!

Yelp has transformed me into a chain restaurant avoider. Well, I'm not anti-chain; I just prefer to find local places instead. So when my cousins wanted to have a birthday dinner at CPK last night, I was pretty meh about the idea. Don't get me wrong. I've always liked CPK. Last night was no exception. Our server, Rachel (from Maryland by way of Austin), was overly friendly. She was so bubbly, it was almost exhausting. At her suggestion, I ended up getting a Kiwi Frozen Lemonade with a shot of Absolut. Excellent suggestion. It was very good! By the way, their White Sangria is also delicious. I didn't plan on eating, but CPK has such a wide selection of salads, I couldn't resist getting their Moroccan Chicken Salad. I should have gone with a half because that thing was huge! And boy was it delicious. I especially like it for the roasted butternut squash, dates, beets, avocado, and toasted almonds. Yum! Well done CPK.

I have been here a few times, but this was visit was more pleasant than before due to the fact I had never tried there dessert!!!  The salad was nothing special.  The pizza was amazing, had pepperoni and cheese....slightly over greasy.  The dessert was really really good!!!  I was at a 4 star before the dessert.  Will definitely come back again.
Kyle is an exceptional server! He always takes great care of me and makes fantastic suggestions when I can't decide what I want. Love going to CPK at Town Square!

I used to love this place when I was younger, but I recently came here for lunch and the food downgraded a lot. I got the california club pizza (I think) and there was way too much spinach on top of the pizza as a 'topping'. They kept falling off and it didn't have any flavor either. We also got the peach salad and I just really didn't like it because of the cottage cheese and raisins. But the complimentary bread we got was great. The sauce that comes with it is my favorite sauce; I even make it at home sometimes. Although the food wasn't outstanding, our server was beyond amazing; he took really good care of us.

I'm not a great fan of Pizza and my gals suggested we go to CPK out of convenience. There were tons of children there, very kid friendly. Our server Zammy was great and accommodated all our requests. She provided excellent service. The food in General was mediocre, just not that great. For a national brand chain it was disappointing. I had the Italian chopped salad which was $10 for a half portion, not that I'm gluttonous but it is as if they split half of a half order. My friend ordered the spaghetti and it was dry. Their notable BBQ chicken pizza in which I tried to just see what the rave was all about. Point blank there is nothing worth raving. Personally, it's overrated and I rather just go to Brio.

This california pizza kitchen is located right next to the sports book area. You can easily request a table with a view of all the sport book TVs. I went during March madness and it was amazing! Noise Level Loud because it is right next to sport book area and casino floor

We were quoted a 10-15 min wait on a Saturday evening, and we were called within the quoted time.  The hostess wasn't in a race seating us and took the time to talk to us and walk at our pace.  Our server Damon made an excellent recommendation for an appetizer, and he made sure to let us know our pizza would take a little longer because it was gluten free (good to know).  Excellent follow up service making sure everything was perfect.  When we were ready to leave, Damon was check ready and had our ticket processed quickly.  The only reason for a 4-star rating is serving size.  For the cost, the pizza could be a little larger.  Overall, I would highly recommend this location as the service and taste of food is excellent!
Love this place.  I have not had a bad dish yet.  I get out to Vegas once sometimes twice a year and every time I go we eat here.  Get in fast, good food, good service great experience.

I've been to a lot of different pizza kitchens across America and honestly I have to say that this was the last place to try on my list. Now I definitely regret even putting this on my to do list, or my "tackle the yummy" list. It's a typical Sunday in Las Vegas, hot and windy. I Mountaintown Square on Las Vegas Blvd. and I'm hungry. So of course I would love to go try something new. Hence California pizza kitchen. So my mother arrives we decide to go in and try it.  All I can say is disappointing! The food lackluster and locked flavor. The presentation was less than heart. And the prices were outrageous. Not to mention their major competitor is Sammy's woodfired pizza. Sammy is offers gluten-free variations of pastas and crusts to appeal to a wider variety of people. To my surprise California pizza kitchen only has five pizzas that you can get the gluten-free crust and has absolutely no other gluten-free menu and no gluten-free pasta. Being a celiac this was disappointing!  Now let's talk about the service. The gentleman seated us was very nice and the weather was nice but completely uneducated in anything that has to do with any aspect of anything Culinary. When I inquired about if they had pasta that was made without me because my son had a dairy allergy he replied "well the only pasta with diary is going to be our fettuccine Alfredo or mac & cheese."obviously I know that Alfredo and macaroni and cheese obviously has "cheese" and has Dairy. So why would I order that for my son? Wouldn't. Again I stated "no, my son has all dairy allergies including eggs. So again that your pasta have eggs?" He quickly ran to go check and came back and stated that all their pasta egg. Again very disappointing. All in all besides the lack of a gluten-free menu, the lack of ambience, the lack of an educated staff, and the outrageous prices, the food  was lack luster and was not visually appealing. Tasteless food never is a recipe for success. Maybe there other restaurants have better chefs? Maybe that's how they got so big? I'm not sure, however I am not on the California pizza kitchen bandwagon!
Service okay but we ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza seriously there one piece of  tiny chicken on each slice and tons of bean sprouts to cover up the lack of meat.

Great Gluten Free options.. I had the Cobb salad it was great. The manager Jessie went above and beyond service to make sure my salad was prepared to my needs due to my Celiac. 5 stars to Jessie the manager

First time and experience was great.  We told our waiter it was our first time and asked for recommendations, although he was a bit vague, we truly appreciated that he brought over a Complimentary appetizer item for us to try. He brought us a flatbread (cannot remember exactly which one..sorry) I thought it was a very nice gesture. Things like that don't happen much these days.  It as ok..a bit salty.  We ended up ordering the bbq chicken pizza, tequila chicken pasta and for appetizers the guacamole and blue corn dip with Chips.  I have to say I wasn't  really impressed.  Our pasta was hard and dip a little too sweet.  Pizza was ok, but nothing made me feel like It's someplace I'd purposely choose to go to again.  Waiter gets 5 stars

The pizzas are delicious I usually order for pick up I have noticed that you're ordering  at a different location and it gets transferred to the restaurant the computers are constantly freezing as you're trying to order and it takes a while for them to transfer your order to the restaurant so when they tell me my order is going to be ready at a certain time it takes about 20 minutes after that time . I think they really need to update the system to make this easier on the customers and employees.

Really great CPK to come to....our server Rich was the sweetest very understanding of our needs. Food is good. Management is always ready to take on any issue that might come up and take full responsibility. I frequent this spot.

I had a gift card and decided to place an order for pick-up. This CPK is located in Town Square. There is a pick-up door, but if there is parking near it I couldn't find it. Crowded is the proper word for Town Square! With no parking spot in sight and tons of people wandering around, hubby dropped me off out front. I was greeted when I walked in and the food was ready. The pizza came in a to-go carrier with handles that was very convenient. I ordered the "Untraditional Cheese Pizza" priced at $9.75 that was cheesy and good. Most pizzas with more than one cheese have a smokey type of cheese on it and this one didn't, which I loved. Simple and good!  You can place your pick-up order over the phone or online. The online ordering is very user friendly.

Been here a few times. Coincidentally the last two times we have gotten the same waitress  (Melissa ) the first time was a Saturday afternoon and it was fairly busy the service was mediocre but the food was good. The second visit was this afternoon.  It wasn't busy at all but we were sat down and greeted by a friendly waiter who stated our waitress was Melissa and she would be with us shortly. The first gentleman took our drink order and returned immediately with our drinks and some bread for snacking. We waited approximately 30 minutes and watched our waitress serve another table their food and greet another table but never having  approached  us. Finally we decided we had waited long enough  and began to walk out finally our waitress  came up and asked where we were leaving too. Needless to say I will not be back again. The food is good but the service isn't worth the wait.

If you are hungry or thirsty and are craving amazing service, you must go to CPK in town square!! I had an unfortunate dining experience somewhere else before stepping into CPK hoping for redemption this evening. My friend and I sat down at the bar and Dylan took our drink order and asked if we wanted some warm bread as we perused the menu. We laughed and told him about our previous experience at the other place and said we've had plenty of bread because that's practically all we got at the other place. He apologized for our bad experience at the other restaurant more than the other staff had. We ordered drinks and food and when we were done Chef Al came to greet us with a beautiful desert dish of red velvet cake and a script of chocolate spelled out "WELCOME". We promised that we would never make the mistake of going to CPK second again... They will always be our first choice!!!  THANKS DYLAN AND CHEF AL!

we went in on lunch today were immediately seated and advised "our server will be right with us"  little did we know right with us meant never.... We witnessed 2 employees walk by numerous times and 2 managers as well continue to walk by our table. one waiter wouldn't even make eye contact with us and the other older gentleman smiled and walked by. We saw a table get seated approximately 10 minutes after us and they were waited on immediately. We still had menus on our table to indicate that we have yet to place our order and still no one would come by and wait on us. Finally after 20 minutes we decided to leave, We walked past the same hostesses that seated us 20 minutes earlier and she automatically said their automatic goodbye "thank you have a good day"  we then advised them that we are leaving because we never got waited on to which they responded "okay have a good day" we then asked "did you hear what we just said... we said, we are LEAVING because no one took our order" she then asked what table number were you at? we just left after the fact that no one helped us and her only response was which table number are you at. if you want to sit in peace and quiet and smell pizza then is the place for you however if you are looking for a place to eat then i suggest you try another restaurant in town square

Town Square is such a beautiful place to walk around and take a break from the strip, but my lunch here was the cherry on top! Such a pretty spot. Definitely sit on the patio. They are attentive and gave us free treats just because it was our first time. The waiter went a little overboard offering add on with everything,  but he was just doing his job. My pizza was delicious, and even better cold when I enjoyed my leftovers later!

Yes, it is a chain, but I have to give stars to this location. Located at Town Square Las Vegas right across from the Container Store. There is also a separate entrance door for just take-out! There are many around Las Vegas, but this location is by far my favorite. The servers are always polite, quick, and attentive. I have never had a bad experience here. Now, the reason I am writing this review is because little things matter to me as well. Recently, they have came out with a new menu and a few things were scratched off.. including my absolutely favorite Tomato & Basil Spaghettini. When I had questioned our server about this, she wasted no time telling me that they would still be able to make it for me anytime I came in even if it was off the menu. So THANK YOU for that :D I have been to this location so many times for lunch dates, dinner dates, catch ups, birthdays, etc and it is always a pleasant experience. So thanks for being you CPK. A list of my favs: - Caesar Salad - Spinach & Artichoke Dip with Tortilla Chips (definitely needs to be shared) - Tomato & Basil Spaghettini - Jambalaya Fettucine - RED VELVET CAKE with Vanilla Ice Cream

This place is a great place to go to get away from the strip without going too far. The service here is better than the California locations. Very attentive  and the lunch sandwich specials are perfect make it a whole sandwich  and you can share and be very full. Very mellow, slow paced (unlike the strip) vibe, and great stores to check out afterwards. Parking is no problem they have plenty of metered and garage parking.

I love CPK! I came to the one over at Town Square for a quick lunch with some friends. I love how the menu offers small plates and meals on the lighter side. I ordered my food from the small plates section. I had my own asparagus and arugula salad and split the Bianco flatbread with my friend.   The arugula salad was perfectly light and not drenched in dressing like some salads are. It was a complete balance of bitterness from the arugula and sweetness from the fire roasted tomatoes. The cheese was sliced so thin that you could see through it, so it also gave the salad a nice savory touch. The Bianco flatbread was stunningly delicious. It was brushed with a thin layer of truffle oil and garnished with a little bit of greens and covered in mozzarella cheese. Within every bite was a whiff of truffle oil. It was a definite five stars overall for the food. I knocked off a star from my rating of CPK because our waitress seemed to be new at her job. She was nervous while taking our order, but she was kind and quick enough to serve us complimentary bread with oil (which wasn't the best bread I've ever indulged on).  However, when we were finished with our food, she came to get our plates, and because she seemed nervous, she accidentally dropped one of our plates on the table and broke it. We knew it was an accident, but I saw the manager standing close by looking at us, and she didn't do anything about it. However, my experience was wonderful at CPK minus the part where the service was a little lacking in confidence and management. I'll definitely be back, but will be hoping for another server.

The food was ok, the service was great, had Ariel as our waitress and she was patient (we came a group with 4 children....)  Overall had a great time. No 5 stars because I rd hunk it's a bit pricey for what u get....

Gluten free!!! Come here if gf food is your quest especially if the rest of your party isn't. Seriously...their gf is REALLY gf. Prepared separately. omg. My kids and I have a new fav spot to chill. I can enjoy a cocktail in a standard glass (just ask the server privately to be discreet) and my kids and I can enjoy a meal adult/kid friendly. I'm amazed. Never been treated so well ANYWHERE. Preach!

Came here for a quick dinner after picking up a friend from the airport. I ordered the grilled veggie sandwich with choice of regular or herb ciabatta, and soup or Caesar salad. I did the herb ciabatta and asked if I could do a house salad with ranch instead, and our waiter said it was fine. My friend ordered a Blue Moon and the traditional crust white pizza.  My sandwich was really good, loved the aioli. I'm a vegetarian and veggie sandwiches are usually a hit or miss for me. This one was tasty and fresh.  It came with a Caesar salad despite my asking for a house salad, but I didn't mind because it tasted fine.  My friend loved his white pizza.  Waiter took a while to grab the check, but someone who looked like a manager came over and grabbed it. He was super nice and apologized for the wait.  Would recommend!

This CPK located in the center of Town Square mall is like any other CPK. Not to say it is bad but a very typical solid experience you get at any national chain restraunt. My review is of their new gulten free menu. It is awesome! They have for pizzas to chose from: BBQ chicken, pepperoni, margherita, and mushroom pepperoni sausage. Right when you you walk and ask the hostess for a gf menu they know what you are talking about, which is nice. The waiters are also well trained and very familiar with the gluten free options. When ever you order gluten free the manager comes over and explains their process of avoiding cross contamination and then hand delivers the pizza to you. The pizza are delicious and high quality. They use a different  gluten free crust, it is about 14 inches in diameter and tastes just like a regular thin crust pizza, or so my girlfriend  says. Keep it up CPK! Thank for being serious about your gluten free options.

We are very disappointed in the CPK response, or lack of response with regard to serving us food with bug contamination. No thank you...we will not accept your $15 gift card, and have already thrown it in the trash. Mistakes happen, and the response is more important than the offending act. I informed Brad the Manger of the place that I am pregnant, and he did not feel any need to follow up with a client that he potentially made ill. Congratulations on your filthy establishment and terrible customer service.  The photo and story have already hit social media, as we do not want you to harm anyone else. Here's to hoping you don't get a bug in your next meal, or hoping you do so someone can show you how proper customer service is delivered. We will never dine at CPK again.

The place is located at the south side at townsquare, if you enter from the main entrance you can't miss it. Came in on a weekend lunch and the place wasn't too busy and was immediately sat down. Waiter was average too, like many of the other reviews my lady's favorite pizza was removed and they couldn't do anything to make it again :( .  The wait for food was pretty long and when it came it honestly wasn't anything too special. We ordered the garlic cream fettuccine and the california club. They didn't taste too bad, but they were very average.  The portions are a little bigger than the norms so you'll end up with some take home :D Overall nothing too bad about this place and nothing too spectacular.
Went here last night for my my husbands and my anniversary. Kevin waited on us and was so patient and so helpful. The wine, food, and dessert were all amazing.  Thank you Kevin.

Who cares if it's a chain? The food and service here was great. I can't say the same for the host 'cause she insisted we sit out in the patio in 106-degree weather 'cause it was packed inside.  The BBQ Chicken Pizza and Avocado Egg Rolls are not adventurous choices but they do the job well and are recommended for first timers. You'll find "California-inspired" dishes here; basically American favorites with ingredients and preparation that's non-conventional, fusion or maybe even rebellious like Kung Pao Spaghetti or Thai Chicken Pizza. CPK is a classy choice if you want a break from delivery pizzas or ummmm those microwavable pizzas -_-

I came here for a quick lunch during my lunch day. Generally I don't like to spend too much money on lunch (cause day after day, that adds up quickly), but I was craving some four cheese pasta. A friend said she thinks CPK had it, so we went there. It was busy, and staff was friendly. We got seated after a few minute wait, and our server was nice and generally pretty efficient. I ordered the four cheese ravioli even though it was a bit more than I wanted to spend (like 14 bucks I believe).  It was pretty "meh." It really wasn't that cheesy, and for four cheeses being in there, I would have thought there would be more flavor. It was bland, the sauce with it was just alright, and all together I was disappointed in the meal.  I haven't tried this location before, but I have also never tried the ravioli at CPK. Maybe it's just not a good dish there.

Miguel the waiter gets 5 stars for sure! We told him it was our first time and he was awesome at recommending things for us he even went above and beyond and brought us something to try free of charge. The food on the other hand was blah. Nothing spetacular not very satisfying.
I only ordered avocado rolls and peach lemonade take out. I don't know if it's too little of an orders but the hostess or greeter helped me was so rude. Her name is Cynthia.

Very little Salmon on Ceasar salad for $15. Pizza came to us cold 20 minutes after they brought salad. Overpriced, but good atmosphere. Waitstaff young and not trained well. Ordered from one guy and by the end of the meal five people had stopped by our table. We didn't know who was waiting on us. Overall, the service was good, the food marginal, and the parking to get there atrocious.

The food was great,  but our server was amazing! Anthony was on the ball.  Our drinks were never empty, our food was fresh and great,  and he was in a great mood. Our server Anthony is the reason we want to go back.  The food was great and something different for us and we want to check out some of the other food they have.  If our server wasn't as great as he was might not have wanted to.

This is one of my favorite places to go when shopping. I always get the same thing but this time I was with a friend so we shared a pizza. We got there during the lunch rush and there was a 10 min wait. That was all fine. When my name was called the host said is outside ok? It was a bit cold in the shade and windy so I asked to be inside. She responded with "well outside is all that's available! You'll have to wait another 15!" She wasn't to pleasant about us wanting to sit inside. I really dislike when hosts act like that at a restaurant. My server was very sweet and friendly. Food was good as usual. My experience was great other then the host with a serious attitude. Don't worry, I'll still be back.

Came in yesterday for an early dinner. I've been going to various Cpks in the past and even though their menu has changed and portions got smaller is time I must say that yesterday was one of the best times yet! Kevin, our server was awesome. Very kind, polite, and informative about the menu! Wish they had more Kevin's out there. Food came out quick and Kevin checked up on us time to time. Let me tell you, not once had we had to ask for anything because he was on top of it! Very much appreciate that!!

This is one of my favorite places to go for salads. I'm a sucker for a good salad and they certainly have them here. Although my wasn't made right at this location it's still one of my favorites.  I love the Roasted vegetable salad with Salmon and the BBQ Chicken salad.
Had a wonderful family dinner and dessert here. *Kevin* the waiter was the friendliest, most accommodating waiter I've ever encountered! Thumbs up.

I was surprised that I didn't have any trouble getting a seat for the lunch rush. Really loved the Caesar salad! Our server was very attentive. They had a problem with the radio though and, while trying to sorry it out, it briefly sounded like a rock concert blaring. Luckily, that didn't take away from the meal.

My boyfriend and I went to CPK last night for date night, they weren't really busy and they were under construction so some part of the restaurant was closed off, we were immediately greeted by the hostess which asked us if we wanted to sit at a booth or a table and we chose the table. She was very friendly, our server Tyler was amazing from the moment we sat down. He was constantly refilling our drinks, asking us if we needed anything and he was so nice! He told us to save some room for dessert but unfortunately we did not. The food was delicious, I wish I would've take it to go but we had a movie to see after. The place is upgrading and the customer service was phenomenal! I will be there again next week for our date night!

We stopped going as much to CPK because they got rid of my husbands favorite pizza..  Buffalo chicken and really haven't found something as good.  Thought we'd stop in last night while shopping in TS and couldn't have had a better experience. Our server Rachel was amazing. So friendly!!  Customer service is a huge deal for us.. Thanks Rachel for making our experience worth coming back.

Food was good for the price paid. I however will not be returning to a CPK after my last three experiences. A few friends and myself were seated next to the server station where the input orders on the receipts.. Little did I realize it was gossip central of the customers they were serving. I found out that Greg doesn't tip well enough, Sandy smelt like a wet rag, and last but not least a manager was having an affair... All things I did not need to know. Unfortunately this was not my first run in and will not be returning.
I ordered a salad and my husband ordered a pizza, food was average, very over priced, and kids everywhere, it was almost like I was at chuck e cheese. I won't go back. Not worth the $$

Easy parking for Town Square.  Great service, food and wine.  Salted Carmel dessert was amazing.  It would be great if they had expresso or cappuccino to go with their fabulous desserts. With the exception of the bday singing and Saturday night wait, it didn't feel like a chain.
I try to have lunch at CPK when I'm in town for business since I can walk around the shops and I'm close to the airport. The salads are always good. The staff is friendly and I love sitting outside!

Something was wrong. California Pizza Kitchen is my FAVORITE restaurant.   We've been here a million times, and the service and food quality was always CONSISTENTLY EXCEPTIONAL.   Not this time.   We walked in, sat down and were so thrilled and happy because my fiance and I had just gotten engaged.  Don't get me wrong- I don't put a price tag on food, so we could have chosen to eat anywhere fancy shmancy to celebrate our recent engagement. But what did lil' ol' me want to do??  I wanted a damn pizza from CPK!  Why? Because it was a refeed day from weeks of lifting and underfeeding (fitness/training talk) and like I said- it's my favorite restaurant, and I am ALWAYS happy when I go to and leave any CPK. Our waiter walked over with a quietly foul, non-chalant, I don't give a sh*t attitude.  Totally killed our mood, but hey- I was okay with it because I just wanted my pizza.  Thai Pizza to be exact.  Edgar ordered fried mac & cheese, and I ordered hummus.  Pita was dry and lacked texture.  Mac & Cheese was dry.  Bleh. My pizza was abysmal.  I've ordered this pizza dozens of times, and I was so disappointed.  But oh well, it is what it is. It was dry and lacked that peanuty flavor that it normally has.  It was just...just.  That's it.  Nothing more to it.  And Edgar's Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza was thin.  We didn't order thin.  I would give this visit a darn 1, but I'll leave it at 3 because I really do love the restaurant chain.  And if you know me-- I don't take to chains too much.   We'll definitely be back because I know it was an anamoly.

Wow this place is good. They really ought to think about expanding California Pizza Kitchen. Their name is a little long though... Ought to use an acronym like CPK.  Don't tell anybody about this little secret of a pizza place. I wouldn't want it to get all commercial and open up locations all over and start selling frozen pizza's at grocery stores.. imagine that.. All kidding aside... In comparison to other CPK's I found the food to be very good and fresh. It's most def in the top tier of CPK's when it comes to quality and service. Our waiter was great, the place was busy, and the food was really good.. Come on.. you know you've been to a less than stellar CPK... This is not one of those.. Very good.

I've been eating @ CPK for years.  Great spot for a group, lunch, get togethers  etc. Just recently had the BUTTER CAKE - Its warm and so daymn good with the ice cream on top! They offer small plates of dishes, which is a great idea.  They've been coming up with new entrees, desserts, coupon promotions.  I'm very happy CPK is still around.  I love their food. This location at Town Square gets really busy, so expect a wait.  Lots of families and kiddies.

Tried to use no stars but wouldn't let me. 4 min wait after we were seated and the place is only 1/2 full. The worst part: they stopped selling Mountain Dew! Never coming back, bad service, high price, and no Mountain Dew. The pizza is not much better than the frozen and it's way quicker to run to the store and cook it than waiting in the restaurant! Used to love this place:(

The location is the best thing about this place.  I know it is a chain but I expected much more.  The customer service from the hostess was good very pleasant and smiled the whole time.  the customer service from the waitress on the other hand was not up to par.  she seemed to be having a bad day.  My drink order was wrong that's an easy fix but then my meal was wrong too.  I ordered the Hawaiian pizza and got the thai chicken pizza instead.  I brought it to her attention but ate it anyway cause at this point I just wanted to get the hell out of there.  Now the pizza itself was good the peanut sauce was very tasty.  I think I would give this place one more chance and update my review.
The food is good and staff are friendly. They also seat you pretty quickly. I love the pizza and the strawberry shortcake here is amazing.

My reason for four stars is because of the service. Otherwise, their menu items are three stars. I was in a rush because I only had about an hour and 20 something minutes to head to work. Starving and coming up a little late on a lunch with my friend, we requested our food to arrive ASAP because of our situation. Our server was extremely kind (I believe her name was Heidi? Wonderful lady!) and got our food out to us in a matter of minutes. Even with our indecision about what wine to taste, she was doing the best she could to help us get in and out (even when her section was half full!) Our food had to have came out in a matter of 10-15 at most after we ordered, because we devoured it and still had time for me to head to work with a minute late to spare. My service experience was excellent, and I recommend if you're in a rush somewhere, don't be shy to tell them! Otherwise, the food is three stars. This isn't saying its bad in the least, but then again there is nothing overly special about it either. The menus do hold a ton of variety when it comes to wines and pizza, so if you're in for a quick lunch, this would be the place in TS to stop by at!

Great food! I know they're specialized in pizza here so I wanted to try something different, I went with one of the salads and the crispy macaroni balls and with sangria. IT WAS AMAZING! Everything was on point. And the service was top notch. GGWP BOYS. HASHTAG: GAME OVER.

it should be a 2.5, not a 3 star.  Great location, clean, friendly.  it was a Sat afternoon, not too busy.  We ordered three soups, Bianco Flatbread pizza and Pesto Cream Penne. Service was marginal even though she tried. Water glass went empty, took a long time for food. when food arrived soups were hot, pasta was warm and the flatbread pizza was barely warm.   Our waitress was very pleasant, replaced our flatbread with a smile, but did not check back with us for sometime, we requested additional pesto sauce - brought it 10 minutes later.  Overall:  Nice location; very clean; friendly; food presentation good, food was okay (pesto pasta was good); service just okay.  I will not go back, there are many other choices. Sorry California Pizza Kitchen

Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (38 of 365). I have a lot of catching up to do! 1 star = for their selection of pizzas.  They have something to cater to anyone's tastes.  I especially like the White Pizza with added mushrooms. 2 stars = fish tacos.  If you're not feeling pizza, their fish tacos are definitely tasty.  They are filling too! 3 stars = BUTTER CAKE!  One word: amazing!  It's a melt in your mouth type of dessert and is a definite must have if you come here! 4 stars = great service by courteous wait and host staff. Lacks 5th star = slow to get our food.  Slower during lunch, a little faster during dinner time for some odd reason.

Ate here for dinner earlier before the dinner rush and the service was great. Our server was very attentive to our needs. Only problem is that our food took awhile to come out. The server brought bread to our table 3 times while waiting.

have tried this place twice now. CPK is usually ok especially with their gluten free pizza options. sadly this one is horrible. Mac and cheese bites are dry and they don't give you enough cheese sauce and a pizza that was ordered to be gluten free was not as it's made my wife who has celiacs sick. The quesadilla was so dry and rubbery I could have folded it into a hockey puck. Bleah. no one was happy with their meal. note this was a take out order on both occasions so maybe they are better inside?

Had Aaron as our server. Himself as a server deserved a five stars!  He gave us great feed back on the dishes we were debating on.. Pure delicious-ness! Deff try the Caribbean sangria! Hate sweet drinks but this was just yum!  Great food & desserts overall.

This was the first time visiting this location. I went at around 3pm with a friend. It was pretty slow inside. Not many people at tables. The place was very clean and the employees I seen were tiding up the place and helping customers. Our waiter was Miguel and he was very nice. He brought our drinks and bread quick and took our order which was just a pizza. The food was brought to our table in a matter of minutes. The bbq chicken pizza was excellent. Miguel checked in several times to make sure we had everything, drinks refilled, and that our food was ok. After the service and quality of food was excellent, I will come back.

Oh my gosh it was great let me start off with that. My friend and her dog came to lunch with me around 4 and it was quiet and the for the outside seating it was a beautiful day. If you have a dog or somebody with a dog a dog is coming just remember the restaurants now at least this one wont allow pets inside the gate only on the outside. But I ordered pasta and my friend she ordered salad and we both loved it. Very nice place to be and hang out so I advise you to try it.
This is a great place for all occasions. Great prices, great food, and great ambiance. Try the Kung Pao spaghetti, it's BOMB!!!!!

The wife and I always stop at this CPK while visiting Vegas. We shared the chicken quesadilla appetizer while she had the BBQ chicken salad with avocado and I had the Bianco Flat bread with extra mushroom. All of the food was very yummy and served in pleasing portions. I also tried the agave mojito which was very refreshing after walking in from triple digit heat. The waiter was prompt and polite. I would recommend.

Great lunch. After buying gift cards for others I finally had lunch. There was 9 of us and there was not a disappointed one in the bunch. From pizza to salad it was all fresh and full of flavor. I will be back.

This location is generally pretty good. Although the other day I had the worst experience. We were seated very quickly but after that it took forever for everything.  It took a while for the waitress (Ariel) to come take our drink order, but thankfully once we ordered them it didn't take too long for them to come out. We ordered the avocado egg rolls as an appetizer. They are normally very good, but this time they were barely warm. The food runner who brought them out actually stopped in the middle of the restaurant to text for a minute and then brought our egg rolls. Extremely unprofessional. I was a little irked that our waitress offered all her other tables bread, but not ours. Since we had ordered an appetizer I wasn't too upset, but the inconsistency in the service was irritating. I order pasta for my daughter, which was also barely warm by the time we got it. The barbecue chicken salad we got was pretty good, but the chicken was dry. And then it took forever to get our check. Apparently texting and talking to other waiters was more important to our waitress than attending to her tables. I understand it was a slow time in the restaurant (a Tuesday around 4 pm) but still try to be somewhat attentive.  Overall, the experience was bad and I don't think I will be coming back to this location. There are plenty of other restaurant options in town square.

I visited the newly remodeled Town Square location on Saturday (11/21) around 11:45am. We asked to sit outside because it was a nice cool afternoon. They sat us and from that point on it was as if we didn't exist. I order what I've been ordering for the last 15 years, the full size BBQ chicken salad. Since I always order that, I know what the portion is supposed to look like. The price has increased and the salad has shrunk. The full size is now comparable to what the half size used to be. I was very disappointed. How do you justify higher price for less food? When they dropped off my salad I asked the guy for a side of ranch. He said "sure" and that was the last I saw of him. I sat there for 15 minutes waiting for someone to come check on me outside so I can ask again. Finally, I had to leave my table and go inside the restaurant to ask a random cashier to get me a side of ranch. By this time, my salad was old, undersized, and just tasted wrong. Perhaps the whole experience is what put a bad taste in my mouth, but I couldn't eat more than one bite. Flagging down a waitress to address my issue was the ongoing challenge of the day (it wasn't busy). My friend that was dining with me literally stood up and waived her arms in the air from side to side to get someone's attention. That didn't work either. She was frustrated for me, and this was holding us up because she was already done eating. She went inside the restaurant and grabbed what seemed to be the manager. I didn't go into all of my issues because I didn't have the patience. I told them the salad that I always get didn't taste right and I just want them to prepare me the Garlic Cream Fettuccine and pack it TO GO since this has been a long drawn out ordeal. I felt like the manager was trying to upsell when he tried to push the grilled chicken option on me. I said "my chicken experience hasn't been good today so I'll pass". He pushed it on me more and I agreed to it just to get it done. I was told the salad would be taken off my bill. I thought to myself "that's a given, the salad wasn't made well, basically untouched and I'm sending it back"... When I got the bill, they offered no discount for my inconvenience, no free dessert, nothing. I'm just very put off by this experience. I hate that I'm going to have to stop coming to a place that I so often visit.

This place is the best! The first time my kids and I walked in ,  the staff made us feel special, everyone was so friendly . The  pizza was very delicious , my kids love their peperoni pizza . I highly recommend this place!

love. love. love. I had a stressful interview on the strip and wanted to get some lunch, so I stopped at a place I know in Town Center- CPK. I sat at the bar, and had the greatest server. He needed a shoutout. I asked him for suggestions on the menu, he had options for me, and suggested two salads, and something that caught my eye- the Spinach & Artichoke Pizza. We discussed in length the difference between that pizza and the classic BBQ Chicken. Well, His suggestions were great, didn't try to oversell me and cracked me up the entire time I was there.  The manager was near the bar area and was extremely involved in the kitchen as well as his serving staff, which was really nice to see.  I have been there twice while in Vegas, and while I love small local business, this is a place I will frequent.

Being on a pizza kick, we are looking for high quality pizza around the valley. The pizza at cpk is about the same quality as some of the other high end chains. The problem here was the service. Unfortunately, our pizza s came out wrong (I had the BBQ chicken with no cheese and hubby the meat cravers, regular.) they reversed the order and his got no cheese. After we flagged down the server, sge apologized and sent them back. Unfortunately, again, she could not keep our drinks full. At one point, I waited so long for a refill, my pizza got cold waiting for a drink. Hubby had to eat  the second half of pizza with nothing to wash it down. His refill never came until after he was done. Very disappointing :(

Every time we come here we always have the best service. Now the food is always great, but it's the service that really makes us keep coming back. Every single waitress we've had works very hard and you can tell they really care about your experience. Definitely the best location in Vegas.

I have eaten at this place 3 times. The first time was great, the second was not good at all. We went back for a 3rd time because we wanted to give it one last chance. Unfortunately when we got there we were told there was no bread to be served, understandable on a busy Saturday night. However it's what took place after that really sealed the deal on whether or not we would return. The waitress brought me a Dr. Pepper that she later admitted she knew was watered down and after she dropped it off with our food, she didn't return for 15 minutes. So, I went my entire meal without a drink. When she returned, which only happened after I requested for the manager, she said she knew it was watered down but served it anyway instead of changing the soda in the back. She made us wait continuously throughout the night for refills, desert and even for our check. I don't complain often, but the icing on the cake was when she brought our check after us waiting for another 10 minutes for it she circled where the tip chart was on the bottom and she made it seem as if we wouldn't have tipped If she hadn't. This was all at 9 o'clock at night when there was maybe 3 tables in her area. The manager was helpful, but I'm not one to complain in store when I have to keep the waiter. The food was good, but such slow service I wouldn't likely return.

While I have eaten at this location and it is fine (yes, kind of loud and lots of kids), my review is for CPK in general.  I agree it is a little pricey for what you get, so we only go very infrequently.   One of my biggest peeves is restaurants that do not have a cravable dish. Well, I love, love, love the waldorf chicken salad and the chicken tostada pizza (with the original crust, they changed it to flat bread, do not order it this way).  As for cpk in general, they can very few and far between have the chain syndrome of off food or staffing, their soda (also like many chains places is horrible) and their "free" bread, that oddly is only served sometimes, is also dry and tasteless, so I am glad that more than not it is not presented because i love bread and don't want to bother eating it.   We have rarely gotten other menu items, when with larger groups we order other random ones and enjoy them....the blt, the buffalo chicken (I think this is gone too) come to mind.  They took my husbands favorite of the sweet sausage and onion off the menu.  That also seems to be a problem for chains....when something works don't change it.....put the tostada pizza back on the original crust or people might not know how good it is.

We went here to celebrate a friends birthday, and had a wonderful time! Our server was very helpful and attentive. I had a strawberry basil margarita which was a little to sweet but refreshing. Now birthday girl had the spicy margarita...I want to say it was made with habaneros...word to the wise don't get this unless you reeeaaallyy like spicy. The sampler plate of spring rolls was tasty especially the southwestern roll. Our pizzas were good my favorite had pear, caramelized walnuts and gorgonzola! Overall great time, super friendly staff and for 4 drinks, 2 appetizers and 5 pizzas it was just a touch over $100.

Always tasty!  With the Family!  Thanks Jamie and Wayne P for the gift card!  CPK was extra awesome tonight because of the outstanding service.  Our waiter Kevin was extremely attentive and helpful.  The new salad (Mediterranean) was delicious, the Thai pizza was great as always, and the 22 0z Stella was a bargain at 6.50.  Kevin was kind enough to provide some wine tastings as well, and that over-the-top service was the 5 star earner.
Really good food! I am surprised to hear about poor service as our server was friendly and our food came out SUPER fast!!!! We will definitely be back!!
Always a great place to go. The pizza is consistent and delicious!! California Club pizza is my standby and so is the spinach dip, nom nom nom

Dear BBQ Chicken Salad,  I have had a major crush on you since about 1999. You are my favorite. I can't have anything but you whenever I dine at CPK. Seriously, I am like your secret stalker. They should probably put me in jail because I DESTROY YOU! Every last bite! You are probably the reason that some Salads get a bad rep, because there is nothing "diet-y" about you. Whatever you do, please don't change. Don't go and get all health conscious or go light on the dressing. Don't loose your tortilla strips or your delicious BBQ coated chicken. Just...be you. Forever. And always.  Love,  Katie S.  PS. This location is ok. Decent service, short wait on a peak night. Others at my table enjoyed their food. Consistent, fresh, fast.

I love coming here but today decided to come for lunch and worst service we were sat right away but then no one came to check on us for about 15 min then a bus boy came to check on us and said "I'm not your waiter but ill get you drinks" we said who is then and he said "I dont kno,were trying to figure that out.  They cut a lot of people and that's why we are short handed. " he was great and ended up waiting on us the whole time. He needs a raise if it werent for him I would say I would never come back.  I dont blame him for bit checking on us since I'm sure this isn't his usual duties.

Had lunch here the other day and our server was very attentive. I order the half peach salad and was amazed by the mix of flavors- delicious! Next time, I will have the dressing on the side- too much in my opinion. Cpk also has a small plates menu and the corn guacamole is awesome!
From the host , Manager , and our Server (Tracey) we were greeted with such excellent customer service! My family and I will definitely be coming back

So glad i finally tried out this place! came here a few nights ago. you know a place is good when they re on a wait on a Wednesday. I had the peach salad. It had caramelized peaches, dried cranberries, Gorgonzola cheese, and red onions on a bed of spinach tossed in a balsamic vinaigrette. I also added grilled chicken to it. Absolutely amazing! My friend ordered the Thai salad and he loved it. I will defiantly be returning!

I like California Pizza Kitchen. It is a great go-to restaurant that is sure to please everyone. The only reason why I gave this particular location 3/5 stars is because of the service. My sisters and I are regulars at the CPK in the Fashion Show Mall. The service there is always excellent. It's weird how we took  it for granted until we started frequenting the CPK at Town Square. The CPK at Town Square has inferior service. They lag on refilling drinks/water, are slow to greet, take your meal order, check on you, etc. Once, we've even gotten a straight up rude waitress. However, the service seems to be improving the last few times I've been. So there is hope!

Dined here with my boyfriend for a late breakfast/early lunch while on this side of town running errands. The ambience inside the restaurant is really pleasant with lots of spacious windows filling the place with sunlight and the woodfire oven mirroring it with bright yellow tile. It's a very pretty space to dine in and the grand windows allow you ample people watching of all the hipsters ambling by.  The restaurant was packed while we were there, so service was a little slow. I had a cup of coffee that was a little stale, but the refill was much better. The coffee wasn't bitter and seemed like more of a light roast. I like that the cream comes in a small glass! Be aware that any of the espresso based drinks run about the same as Starbucks prices. They seemed to have a decent selection of beers but it was too early for me to dwell on them long. We started with their minestrone soup, which was thick with different ingredients but wasn't mindblowingly amazing. I've had a richer depth of flavor in homemade versions, but it was a decent restaurant adaptation.  The salad we sampled had arugula, asparagus, parmesan, almonds and a few other simple toppings. It was a light starter on a long rectangular plate that made it easy to share between the two of us.  We had their vegetarian pizza with japanese eggplant and it was nice but fairly small. You would definitely need two pizzas if you were with a group of three or more very hungry people. Since we had shared a salad and a soup prior to having the pizza, it was a good amount of food to sustain us through "brunch"-time with two slices left over to provide a light meal for my boyfriend later in the day.  The pizza had a thin crust with a nice chewiness to it and the toppings were well chosen for the pizza but a little sparsely placed. There were large pieces of broccolini/broccoli rabe/baby broccoli that were hard for me to bite through and interrupted the otherwise lovely texture medley. I don't recall the eggplant standing out, which was a little disappointing but it may have just been covered in cheese.  Next time we venture over to this area there's a good chance we'll return to sample some of their other pizzas with some friends so we can have a better sampler of their offerings!

I'm not one to write reviews for larger chains mainly because if you've eaten at one it's very likely the other chain in the other part of town isnt much different.  Other reviews for this CPK are a tad old so now would be a great time for a refresher review. Due to it's location at Towne Center the place is kinda packed with local shoppers and tourists alike, being crowded means being noisy, servers do tend to rush to get finished customers out and new customers in to keep the business moving. This is nothing new and should not count toward their overall score unless they stand there staring at you arms cross tapping their foot in a gesture that clearly says 'order desert or GTFO' I completely agree with Ken O's observation that some of the menu items are a tad on the expensive side and are a bit too exotic. The chain seems to focus on a shot gun spread approach instead of specializing.  After over two years going to continue on Audrey W's review and report that the BBQ Chicken Pizza is still light on the sauce but still tasted pretty good.  Lettuce wraps were pretty awesome but they need to use fresher shrimp. The texture of the diced up frozen stuff they use is too mushy and it doesn't stand out among the other ingredients. Same goes with their water chestnuts as well, out of the entire entree i can only recall biting into something crisp that wasn't lettuce maybe three times. Buddy got the standard 'oldie but goodie' pepperoni pizza. The pie was a bit greasy but a pepperoni pizza not having a noticeable layer of shine on top is like a zebra not having black and white stripes. One thing i did notice was the taste of the areas that didnt contain pepperoni. They were like black holes sucked away all the flavor and experience to leave you plain and unsatisfied.  From reading past almost year old reviews i can say the service has improved. There's a manager on the floor helping out the servers and ensuring quality control and getting feedback. Our own server was like a hawk...with video cameras...and a surveillance van commonly seen in police films and movies. If i were to give him a motto for the day it would have to be "leave no glass empty" seriously he swapped out our drinks when we had only a quarter left and during that time between debating if one should get the bill and call it or order a dessert and dread the gym the next day he still refilled our drinks. Homeboy hooked it up and earned himself a phat tip in the end. Overall I can predict we'll be coming back here within the next three months.

Delicious food and courteous service provided by staff from the beginning to end of your dining experience. We are excited for the brand to be opening in Summerlin as well as we have frequented Town Square as a local destination.

The worst service I've ever had at this CPK. My waitress was Tracy and I've got to say she's one of the worst servers I've seen. When we asked for bread, she only gave us 3 pieces and we were four people while we saw a group of 2 get 5-6 pieces of breads. While we had our food she didn't come to see how the food was. While we were eating she just dropped down the bill  like she wanted us out in a hurry. My mother was eating her Cobb salad and the bacon was cold and raw. My father ordered a vegetarian pizza and asked for goat cheese and when the pizza came it had no goat cheese and on the bill they charged us extra for goat cheese. The pizza I ordered was a barbecue chicken and it was good. But like I said she rushed us out. When we were eating she came up to us and asked us for dessert. While my family was of course still eating. She deserved no tip at all. I would recommend while in Las Vegas. Don't go this California pizza kitchen. I'd  recommend the ones at downtown summerlin, which has excellent service and the fashion mall had a good one. But finally I've got to say WOW! A fast food place can do better than you guys.
